text:
Saya bersama dengan istri saya menginap di Luna2 Studiotel dari tanggal 22 - 24 Desember 2015 untuk bulan madu kami. Sesampainya di sana, kami disambut bagaikan tamu VIP. Kami mendapatkan welcome drink berupa wine dan coklat yang berisi wine (Very nyummy).

Para karyawan dan karyawatinya memakai costum retro ala 70an. Dengan suasana lobi yang modern, memberikan paduan yang sangat unik. Sangat kreatif menurut kami.

Tak lama setelah kami check-in, kami disambut oleh Front Office Managernya Jessica Lee Cook. Beliau sangat ramah dan memberikan gambaran kepada kami yang kebetulan baru pertama kali ke daerah Seminyak tentang lokasi-lokasi yang dapat dituju dengan menggunakan taxi.

Setelah kami menyelesaikan welcome drink and snack kami, kami dibawa oleh Bellboy yang merangkap Room Service (Sayangnya saya lupa namanya). Beliau juga sangat responsif dan ramah dalam menanggapi permintaan kami,

Ruangan yang kami tempati adalah Mayfair Sunset Studio, dengan salah satu balkoninya menghadap pantai. iPod yang dilengkapi dengan banyak pilihan musik, yang dapat disesuaikan dengan suasana yang diinginkan. iPad juga tersedia yang dapat digunakan untuk melihat pilihan menu breakfast, lunch, dan in-flight dining.

Di dalam ruangan yang kami tempati juga terdapat mesin pembuat kopi dengan 3 pilihan jenis kopi (Recommended). Untuk yang rindu dengan suasana retro, cobalah menonton Brionvega TVnya. Tidak lupa juga untuk menyinggung suasana kamar yang sangat cozy dan bersih.

Keesokan paginya, kami menikmati hidangan breakfast yang sangat luar biasa dengan banyak sekali pilihan menu ala-carte dan buffet. Untuk yang suka berenang, jangan lupa mencoba kolam renang di sini.

Malam harinya, kami juga tidak lupa mencoba Lunaplex. Kebetulan pada saat malam tersebut kami menonton film Elf. Kursi malas yang nyaman dengan pilihan snack dan drink yang memuaskan.

Pada saat kami diminta untuk menuliskan satu nama karyawan/karyawati yang ingin disampaikan, kami kebingungan untuk menulis satu nama, berhubung semua karyawannya sangat ramah dan responsif!

Untuk kunjungan ke Bali yang berikutnya, kami pasti akan balik ke sini lagi.

Love,
Tanaka - Michelle
title: Gabungan antara suasana Retro dengan design yang Modern

text:
We were looking for a quiet place to relax away from the hustle and bustle and we definitely found it here.
Hidden in a small cul de sac, 2 mins walk to the beach and away from the noise but close enough to walk to the areas with restaurants and bars (10-15 mins) this hotel is perfect for a couple’s retreat.

Decor is really cool and funky, the pool is large, the rooftop bar gets a lovely view of the sunset. There is also a cinema room with reclining chairs and a bar- really cool concept.

We stayed in a studio apartment which was large, bright and clean. 

Staff were brilliant- very nice and helpful. We celebrated my husband’s birthday there and they got us a cute wee birthday surprise cake after breakfast which was held in the rooftop bar that morning.

Breakfast was tasty- choice of western dishes to order, small buffet of pastries/ fruit and coffee/tea.

The only service we didn’t use was the transport due to their high prices- pick-up from the airport was quoted at IDR 450k (taxi cost us IDR 300k - 100k of that was due to the taxi driver conning out of us for an airport toll charge) and one way transfer to Ubud would have cost us 750k (Ubud hotel picked us up for IDR 350k- note, not a tour, just transfer).
title: Peaceful place in otherwise hectic area

text:
Decided to try this hotel because of the many 5* reviews.  Unfortunately, our high expectations were not met.

We decided to book direct because the reservation matched the rate that was in OTA.  The responses from Made were prompt and friendly.  Good first impression. 

Upon check-in, we asked for the complimentary sunset cocktail and was immediately told it was not in our package although it was written on our booking confirmation.  After rechecking, they informed us that it was included but it was already past sunset time and we already made plans for dinner outside.

The property is not as great as we expected.  It is not big although the room is larger than most hotel rooms that we have stayed in Bali.  It is just a concrete without much warmth.  The room seems outdated. 

The toiletries are simple.  They ran out of toothbrush on our first night.  

Service is ok.  

Location is not easy to reach by foot.  It is quite a long alley to reach from the main Seminyak road. 

What  we love  most from staying here is the beach which is about 2 minutes walk from the hotel. We just love walking along the soft sand. It was the highlight from our Seminyak stay. 

For the price that we paid, it is not value for money. But, seeing the many 5* reviews, maybe we missed a few things from in this property.
title: Great beach but average hotel

text:
This hotel is an hidden pearl.
Located at Semyniak, a little bit off the center but so quiet.
The beach is at 200m of the hotel, and is not crowded.
Quiet area, silent room.
The hotel only possess few rooms and that's all good, so it's not a mass tourism style hotel and I do enjoy that !
The cleanliness is top notch, service is as good too.
The hotel staff is professional, very friendly, smiling and so lovely. Stay there and just forget anything !
The food of the restaurant is very good, tasty and a touch fancy, the meal price is thus in agreement.
The private cinema is a big plus !
The atmosphere and the decoration of the hotel are quite unique, James Bond style (60s style).
The staff uniform is also inspired about it.
The top terrace offers a lovely view to the sea.
The room I had was woowww... Spacey, genuine, unique, comfortable, huge bathroom with separated shower and bathtub, despite bad TV signal (I didn't watch TV on holidays).
Large and comfy bed, effective AC. Balcony view to the swimming pool and to the beach on the left end side.
The sound system (iPOD included in the room) in the room is quite welcome to create your ambiant mood. An iPAD is also provided with all the hotel information included inside.
The price/quality ratio is awesome.
Very enjoyable place ! I would definetly return there if I had the opportunity.
Absolutely recommended for couple, everything you need are there !
Well done Luna2 !!
title: Excellent experience

text: Quirky and excellent accommodation. The rooms are quite different with a space theme which is a bit weird for Bali but that’s what makes them so interesting.  They're a good size, have good amenities, shower etc and very quiet. Staff are fantastic and the location right beside the beach is handy (wander along the beach to pick out a breakfast place).  The swimming pool was  big and the food served  excellent.  The rooftop bar is also a  bonus. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it for a change from the "normal" Bali places.

text:
Dream hotel with fantastic view 1min beach walk.

Dream hotel with fantastic view 1min beach walk

It is  rated and IS number  designer/boutique best small hotel is the world...You are looking not only at designers hotels BUT everything you could possibly would like to have it in your hotel at your disposal…Music in the room (Ipod provided with extensive playlist and tablet to use), movie in your own movie theater (movie can be arranged, requested or as is scheduled).
Did I mentioned 25 meter pool??? Open late, can be requested to be open later. Very clean, reliable and very shockingly great!
Yes great breakfast, drinks with stunning view, Bar restaurant, great prices view. Room design is going to blow your away but I guess not as much as excellent customer service and smiles everywhere. 

14 rooms gives your privacy and quiet, at the same time rooms are spacious and accommodating (like an apartment)...amazing how can you fit all in one?
Interesting enough it suits families(movie theater, location, space) and couples(quite, next to nightlife view). You even have TV in your bath tub...
Design is  in such a way you won’t need reservation for lounge outside near pool or just place to swim. Who designed this hotel is genius, but owner needs to advertise it more. It is so underestimated...wait maybe not or I won’t have a place to stay, I will be here on vacation….lol

This is a designer hotel with stunning rooftop bar, impeccable service, excellent food (lamb is only from New Zealand, high quality, for example and you can have it over the weekend on rooftop), view almost anywhere. Free shuttle will accommodate where driver can take you, and they go above and beyond (spas recommendations/reservations, airport lounges, restaurant suggestions on budget and cuisine your heart desires).
title: Dream hotel with everything at your disposal including your dreams

text: We chose luna2 for our 2nd visit to bali for one simple reason. It looked cool! Not because it was close to the beach or because it was located in seminyak. The staff are great and are very friendly. Breakfast is adequate and location is a small walk away from the busy seminyak streets (5-10 minutes). Definitely stay if you are looking for a modern themed hotel which seems quite hard to come by in South East Asia

text:
This is a five star hotel, yet they offer a personal touch that you do not encounter nowadays at such hotels.
The manager welcomed us upon arrival & asked us every morning about our plans & made Bali look like a dream & it sure is.
When we left the hotel, three staff members bid us farewell & asked us to come back.

It’s a one minute walk from the beach & the hotel gives you towels for personal use. They too have a pool that’s suitable for lapses...

Breakfast is great divided into buffet & you can order a la carte too, as part of the package...

Rooms are spacious & have a balcony that overlooks the pool...

Lovely hotel but most important is the smiley highly professional staff...

Thank you for making our stay pleasant.

Iman & Humam / Jordan

text:
Not my first time to the location, so I wasn’t really surprised that the location is a little tricky to find (as are all the great spots anywhere), but it was my first time to stay as a guest.

Start with the checkin by the amazing ladies behind the reception counter, dressed in their space silver air hostess outfits.  They are extremely friendly, informative and have done their homework.  The service feels very personal.  Well done. 

The rooms don’t really have numbers as such.  The hotel room system is set up like the streets on a monopoly board, which apart from being really creative, turns the hallways of what I usually think is the most boring part of any hotel, into something that is very “instagram worthy”.  My room was on Mayfair blue.

Inside the room, with the champagne cocktail and chocolate just walking in is pretty wow, but when the staff start taking you through then you realise this is really something different.  Everything has a story, so better I just list to save time.  
1. Loaded iPod with Bose speak
2. Huge sofa the length of the room 
3.massive balcony 
4. Super comfortable bed
5. Tv in bathtub
6. Tv in main room
7. Retro tv with own Bose headset in case you want to watch something different. 
8. Great amenities 
9. Kitchenette 
10. Coffee machine
The list goes on. 

For the included breakfast, you choose from the al a carte menu, with the continental setup for you to take while you wait.  The menu for the breakfast is by far one of the most Creative I have seen in a hotel.  

Inside the hotel, 1 of the services that I did not get the chance to use was there in-house cinema.  They have 2 screenings a day and I’m kicking myself I didn’t do this because it looks like something special.  In the room service menu, I did notice something else I didn’t use as well.  They call it in-flight dining, which is a premium dining experience they provide for you in the room.  I stayed midweek so the nightclub downstairs wasn’t happening, but I have been there over a weekend and the best way to describe it is Lunar. 

All in all this was an incredible stay, Super comfortable and amazing service.  Great job.
title: Shoot to the Moon!!

We looked at some of the guest rooms and they are stunning! Every detail has been considered and each room is unique. 

I had lunch here with friends and the food is the best I had while in Bali. I had the superfood salad which was fresh and filling. Be sure to try to house-made iced tea- it has cinnamon in it and it's so refreshing on a hot day! 

We also saw the wine cellar and they have the biggest selection in Bali including champagne! 

I highly recommend this place! Even if it's just for lunch, dinner or a movie.

text: Don't leave 28 years between your first visit to Bali and your next - I did and I shouldn't have done!  We loved the Luna2; the design is wonderful; bright, airy and of course, funky.  The rooms were enormous with lots of really useful features: a dedicated area to charge phones and cameras, lots of space to put things down, a decent sized shower and comfy beds.  The pool was great - a decent size to swim proper lengths.  The location is perfect, next to the beach and a short walk to the delights of Seminyak.  The greatest attribute of the Luna2 is the staff; they could not have been more helpful.  They organised road trips, surfing, scooters - anything we wanted.  we had a ball and would recommend the Luna2 studiotel for the perfect family holiday. And I mustn't forget the yummy breakfasts and delicious cooking from Alanna and her team

text:
This is a seriously fun and quirky hotel in Seminyak. You can tell the owners had fun coming up with the concept. The attention to detail is meticulous. From the incredibly indulgent cinema lounge with a popcorn machine and chairs that recline fully horizontally to the disco lounge on the basement with a pole for serious pole dancing. Imagine the fun my friends and I had spinning there. Sunset drinks were at the bar on the top floor with unobstructed views of the ocean and espresso martinis that could be a tad less sweet.  
The staff is lovely and well trained. The barman prepares possibly the best Bloody Mary's by the pool. The food menu at the restaurant is rich and varied. The wine selection is ample. We complained that the pizza was a bit too soggy because it had too much cheese and the chef came, apologised and took the pizzas back only to return with the most amazing crunchy pizzas. 
The rooms have everything that you need in a good hotel. An iPod with a great selection of music from every era, a minibar that's more like a mini convenience store with eye drops for the jet lag and the hangover, deodorant and everything you need. 
I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for sheer unadulterated fun by the beach and in the heart of Seminyak.
title: Quirky, fun and well managed boutique hotel on the beach

text:
Thanks to Luna 2 team for a fantastic weekend hosting a group of friends. From the warm staff welcome with cold cocktail and towel right through to the good-bye things were top notch !  We were never bored, with various venues to have fun - the amazing sunsets on the roof top, evening fun in the private club Pop, and the great food in the cool and cozy restaurant !  The funky urban pool also a great place to chill during the day with push-button service. The huge rooms also great for a down time or to keep the party going. What an amazing place for groups of friends to meet up and catch-up.  The entire hotel is very social and we ended up having drinks with other guests who also seemed to be using Luna 2 as a global meeting place.

Looking forward to our next launch !

text: Thank you yet again to the fabulous staff at Luna2 for making our return visit to this unique and totally fun boutique hotel, a another memorable occasion. We checked in with a group of friends for the weekend and we were met with big smiles, an ice cold fresh flannel and a refreshing cocktail. We all agreed it was like journeying to another world.  The rooms are a very generous, comfortable size and very well equipped.  The food is delicious and certainly the best for a hotel anyone had yet to experience. The staff are super friendly and very efficient. We moved around the hotel from top to bottom - that is from the restaurant to the roof top bar for sunset drinks (gorgeous view) and eventually  down to Pop, Luna2's private and very intimate basement nightclub. Then we enjoyed a day by the swimming pool, devouring those delicious Luna2 gourmet burgers and hot dogs, lots of rose wine and of course back up to the sunset lounge for cocktails.  Did I mention Luna2's private and very lush cinema?  What a perfect way to round off our weekend with Sunday lunch a movie, popcorn and one last cocktail before we get orbited back to earth.  It's official, Luna2 is one glorious world definitely worth discovering. They don't call it "a space for jettingsetting lunatics" for nothing! 🤣
title: Another world

text: Luna2 is an amazing wonderland for fun in Bali. It's tucked away down a charming little street but puts you right on the beach and near to all the best places in Seminyak. There's a cool design edge to every element-monopoly references and quirky artwork. The studios are spacious and packed with all the essentials and more. We love Space -the rooftop bar with expansive ocean views for sunset drinks (2 for 1 cocktails-and great wine list). And if you're lucky enough to be around for the Sunday roast- do not miss it- you'll score perfectly cooked meats and roast vege with all the trimmings- (the clear influence of their top Australian chef). And breakfasts are a winner too- gorgeously presented and flavoursome. Staff are friendly and helpful- Definitely well worth it for a unique stay in Bali-

text: We booked their Sunset Suite back in July 2016 & paid in advance. There is only 1 such suite in the 14 room boutique hotel & it's the only one with view of ocean & sunset. They extended another guest's stay in that suite, so it wasn't available on our arrival--which was, of course, very upsetting. Citra Dewi, front desk manager, did everything possible to make up for this mistake: complimentary pick up & delivery, late check out on day of departure with no extra charge, set meal complimentary dinner on 1st evening, & reduced rate for entire stay. All of her amends were very gracious & appreciated. We stayed in a deluxe grand suite for 1st 3 nights--larger than the sunset suite & better lit bathroom BUT no view (just the narrow pool which is nice for swimming, but not much to look at.) Luna 2 has all the gadgets & amenities--many evenings they drove us to our dinner location. Sadly the projector in their small theater was broken; so, no movie watching. Aside from the guests in the Sunset Suite we were the only other hotel guests--rainy, low season?? We did have lots of sun; BUT the  beach which is about a100 meter walk: grossly disappointing--filthy dirty, dirty water in spots & a very big "let down". Wonderful, attentive service, but hard to really judge, since we were the only guests for several days. The décor is really different & totally unique.
title: NICE & REALLY DIFFERENT BOTIQUE HOTEL

text:
We stayed for a week at Luna2 and were blown away by the hotel and its wonderful staff. From start to finish we were taken care of with recommendations for things to do around Bali, great customer service, excellent western-style food, and a very well-designed property.

The location is within walking distance to Seminyak square, the Ku De Ta, Potato head, and a ton of bars/restaurants/shops. It is also right next to the beach, separated only by their private hotel. I will say that during December at least, the beach is not a reason to select this hotel (it is covered in trash) - but that is not Luna2's fault.

The hotel has a rooftop bar with beach views, a private cinema with daily showtimes, a bar downstairs next to the cinema, a pool, and a great restaurant serving primarily English food. It all has a very western/modern feel, so stay here with the understanding that it's not a 'traditional' hotel for Bali. That said, we enjoyed every moment of our stay and experienced plenty of Balinese culture outside of the property.

I would absolutely recommend this hotel to friends and family.
title: Great hotel, deserving of its 5 star rating

owner_response.text:
Dear RoDubbs

It was certainly our pleasure to ensure that you enjoyed your entire stay, not just with us, but with our recommendations the Luna2 team provided as well.  Our staff will be delighted to read your positive words relating to service and I will be sure to pass on your kinds words regarding the food to our Head Chef Alanna and her team

Yes, I am agree that we have a great location and we are always happy to know that our guests enjoy and take advantage of it, in Seminyak only a short distance from all the great restaurants, bars and beach clubs.  

Garbage on the beach is submissions from the river that surround the coast. Trash washed up river during the rainy season which each end of the year and the beginning of the year. The conditions were very embarrassing for Bali. However our staffs and the local community each morning always clean up trash that washed up on the beach.

It is fantastic you got to experience all aspects of Luna2, including our award-winning wine list in Orbit restaurant, Pop! lounge bar, Lunaplex, cinema and The rooftop bar, Space champagne & caviar, which is a favourite spot for many of our guests, 

On behalf of the entire Luna2 team, we would like to thank you again for recommending us and look forward to seeing you back at Luna2 in the near future. Thank you once again for your in depth review.

If you've looked at the photos, you know it's going to be funky, but what you can see is the incredible quality and attention to detail of not just the rooms, but the entire hotel. 
From the moment we checked in, we really were treated like royalty - and the staff just got better and better. Of all the 5 star hotels we've stayed in around the world, none can compare to the feeling of being amongst friends like it does here. Arif, the guys in the bar upstairs, the cleaning staff - all are happy to chat, share information and make you feel like you're part of a big family. Nothing was too much trouble, and we joked that the cleaning staff had us on surveillance as once we left the room for more than 2 minutes; we'd come back to a faultlessly clean room. 
The food was exceptional, the drinks delicious in Space bar, all in all - just fantastic. 
We can't wait to come back and enjoy this absolute gem.

I have been lucky enough to stay three times at this cool beach front hotel while on work trips. 
Visionary and charming are the words I would use for this hotel. The interior design is remarkable, and is a must visit for design fans when in Bali. 
The food was delicious, especially the steak, oysters and caesar salad. Chef Alanna and Sidney are a credit to your team.
The service from all the staff was exceptional, I even received a delicious cocktail and Rubix cube chocolate on arrival after a long flight from London. 
The cinema is a great addition, with regular showings of new films. Another highlight is that the hotel is within walking distance to the heart of stylish Seminyak and beachfront. 
Overall, a truly enjoyable stay and I highly recommend for work trips and family stays.

text: This was our second visit, although the first with our kids (aged 9 and 6).  From being picked up at the harbor, to being dropped off at our last stop, everything was fantastic. We had a studio room connected to a grand studio for the four of us and the rooms provided a huge space to unwind and interact with each other.  The kids loved the funky design of the rooms, particularly the bath with tv.  But the rooms are really just the start.  It is a cliche, but it is the people that contribute so much to the experience at the hotel (and it is an experience, rather than just a place to sleep).  We were able to experience a family meal in Orbit, a cocktail course on the rooftop bar, the kids had a cooking class in the private villa (wow, just wow), the cinema and the fabulous pool - all things made so much better by the Luna2 team.  I would not hesitate to come back here, and plan to do so soon.

text:
The Luna2 is not a standard Hotel, even by Bali standards. 

First the design is amazing, and am really impressed they manage to maintain it flawlessly, despite the proximity of the ocean. If you have a chance, book the Mayfair3 room, that has a balcony on the ocean and a balcony on the pool, to enjoy spectacular sunsets from your bed... The rooftop bar is great also for starting your evening, and the Mondrian pool is just stunning.

But the most important about Luna2 is the spirit and the team. Those people make you feel even better than at home. The kindness of everyone, the real genuine caring are palpable in all interactions you have with the crew, and they will find any ways to make your stay a fantastic experience. It is also fantastic to see the same faces working there years over years, showing management dedication to local sustainability.

And finally the restaurant food has greatly improved, it keeps a flavour of English food, but modern, lighter, more adapted to the bali usual weather. Thanks again to all the team, it was another fantastic stay !!!
title: Always at the top, a fantastic experience !

text:
I recently stayed in Luna2 with my partner and I have to say the whole experience was very special.
 
We were greeted by highly professional, knowledgeable and friendly staff. While they were processing our check in we were served tasty champagne cocktails accompanied by luna2 chocolate– thumbs up for the champagne cocktail, a very nice, refreshing surprise after our journey there.
 
The Grand studio we stayed in was really well equipped with all the gadgets you could possibly need and the staff gave us very knowledgeable  explanations of all the facilities. The studio is the perfect size with its quirky design and balcony overlooking the pool area. The entire hotel complex has a very intimate and private feel. We enjoyed the well stocked mini bar and all the additional essentials in the bathroom! 
 
We were lucky as the weather was stunning so we decided to watch the sunset with a few cocktails on the roof top bar. As cocktail lover again I have to give a thumbs up for very creative, high quality cocktails – both taste and presentation were 5 star. Definitely a highlight for me. The unobstructed view of the sunset was also spectacular.

We took the recommendation to have the room service ‘Inflight Dining’ experience for dinner which was so well presented and all tasted delicious – that was fun.
 
We were really happy with our stay there, everything exceeded our expectations and we will definitely stay again.
 
Big thanks to the awesome, attentive manager who made it all more special for us.
 
Bonus: Perfect location. Right on the beach and walking distance (if you actually wanted to leave the hotel) to all the hotspots like Kudeta.
title: Perfect Cocktails and location

text:
We were recommended to Luna2 Studiotel and we weren't let down.  Located in the happening area of Bali at Seminyak and right next to one of the more gentler beaches.  We are a family of 5 and the connecting suites were perfect for us. The Grand Studio came with a small kitchen/bar, an amazing circular lounge and a huge balcony - it connected to a smaller suite for the kids. We could easily hang out in the main suite.  Plenty of room.   

The design is truly inspired - the designer must be very creative. A wonderful funky vibe around space travel and Monopoly.  

We loved hanging out for sunset cocktails on the rooftop bar sipping sublime cocktails prepared by the amazing knowledgeable staff.  This experience was enhanced as our young kids were looked after by the hotel's wonderful nanny and other staff.  The kids were sitting in the huge soft chairs in the cinema room eating pop corn watching the daily children's movie. 

They kids joined us for the superb food served in Luna2's own cozy yet funky restaurant. The food was very special prepared by international chefs. In the evenings we joined some friends in the night club downstairs.  They have a great range of wines and cocktails there. 

The days were spent lying by the colourful pool sipping flat whites and the occasional cocktail.  

We ate outside a couple of times as Luna2 is only a 5 min drive to "eat street" with a great range of restaurants. It is also only a short beach walk to our favourite place - Ku De Ta. 

If you like small hotels with a lot of thought given to design and guest experience in the cosmopolitan heart of Bali then this is the place for you. Highly recommend it.  We have been to Bali many times and will certainly be returning to Luna2 Studiotel.
title: Fab destination for those looking for a "cool" break in Bali

owner_response.text:
Dear Luna2 guest
 
Many thanks for writing such a comprehensive review on your Luna2 experience.
It is great you were able to enjoy our interconnecting rooms as a family, Melanie Hall, Luna2 founder & designer, certainly had families in mind when she designed the layout of Luna2 and the studios. The interconnecting studios and grand studios are a perfect combination, with parents and kids alike being able to stretch out and relax. I am also so pleased to know your children enjoyed a few movies in Lunaplex cinema – it is always a favourite!

text: I have been coming to Bali for over 20 years and stayed in most of the big Brands and Balinese hotels that are on offer.  Luna2 is by far the funkiest and "un-Bali" hotel around.  I stay regularly for business, and I like the fact that it is quiet, clean and with great staff.  The decoration in the rooms are certainly not done in the usual Balinese style, but they have everything that you need - A bit fridge stuffed with "stuff", coffee and tea making facilities, plus some hotplates if you want to cook something.  The food is always good and they have an extensive wine list.  A short walk to the beach you can turn left and wander down to Legian or turn right and head down to Seminyak proper.  It is a 15 minute walk through to a wide range of restaurants.

text:
Loved this quirky and hip little hotel! Only 14 rooms, you almost felt like you had the place to yourself. 

The decor was amazing and the theme carried on throughout and was done so well.

I found all the staff to be very friendly and very helpful. The manager was great at recommending great places to eat and was happy to book for us. 

The rooms were very well equipped including a bunch of stuff you may have forgotten (which you could purchase for a fee) like mouthwash, panadol, toothbrush etc. 
The shower Gel, shampoo and conditioner provided smelt really nice, but these were the only things provided, so none of the usual shower cap, sewing kit and things like that that you normally get.
The rooms were cleaned very well.

The pool area was nice although there were no views, just a courtyard type area. Great service round the pool at just a touch of a button which was a great.

The WIFI in our first room on level 1 was great, we were then moved to a room on the top floor due to an issue which was quickly sorted by management and the WIFI in that room was not so great as it just kept dropping out all the time, although round the pool area it was good.

Breakfast was nice, a very small selection in the buffet and then a menu you could choose from. We also ate an evening meal in the hotel which was just beautiful and very tasty.

The actual location of this hotel was what has stopped me giving it 5 stars. It was not very easy to walk into Seminyak via the streets as they were very busy with cars and motorbikes and were very narrow with no pavements. You could however walk along the beach to get there (less than 10 minutes) and that was easy enough but we found the beach to be quite smelly and dirty which was a real shame.
title: Lovely quirky hotel!

owner_response.text:
Dear Monique140968
We thank you for your recent stay with us, and for taking the time to post your review.
I am glad you loved our Luna2 studiotel, and Melanie Hall, Luna2 founder & designer will be pleased to know you found her décor amazing. 
We appreciate your honesty regarding the location, and I am sorry this is what held you off scoring 5 stars. I agree unfortunately Seminyak Beach is one not one of Bali’s most pristine white sand beaches.  It is one of busiest, since Seminyak is the island’s most fashionable locations, and there are many popular restaurants and beach clubs along the oceanfront. And it is true that Bali’s roads often leave much to be desired, so we suggest guests who prefer not to walk along our surrounding lanes to request a complimentary drop to the other areas of Seminyak, and our reception is also happy to arrange a taxi.

text:
If I'm honest, I have found Luna2 a hard hotel to rate and a hard hotel to review. I will explain why at the end.

The staff are extremely helpful, friendly and conscientious, from the management through to the room cleaners. We couldn't fault them. They are very efficient and really keen to make sure you enjoy your stay.

The hotel itself is uniquely styled and we found the decor and furniture really fun. There was a really high attention to detail and the theme was carried throughout.

The rooms are well equipped with a kitchenette including a stocked SMEG retro refrigerator as the "maxi-bar" and everything else you could possibly need. There is a huge amount of storage, power points and seating. They have two or three TV's in each room and a good selection of channels including movie channels. The rooms all have views of the pool area and one or two rooms have a sea view although it is over roof tops as the hotel is not directly on the beachfront. There is a Nespresso coffee machine in each room which is complimentary and that was also a great touch.

The pool area carries on the theme and is a quiet refuge from busy Seminyak. Service is available around the pool at the press of a button which is a really cool feature.

They also provide complimentary membership to Canggu Beach Club which is a short drive away. This is partly because there is no gym on site. 

The hotel was very helpful in making restaurant recommendations and bookings for us and also providing us with transport to and from the restaurant when we gave them notice. The transport service is based on availability though. We ate often at the hotel. Breakfast is a mix of à la carte and a very small buffet selection. The quality was good although the menu was small. We had a really great dinner in the orbit restaurant one night but also had a couple of fairly average dinners from the all day room service menu.

The rooftop Space Bar is a cool spot for a cocktail and to watch the sun go down.

There is a cinema in the basement which we did not use but it certainly looked good and the movies that were scheduled twice daily were fairly up to date and would be a good way to spend a couple of hours with popcorn and cocktails.

The reason I found this hotel hard to rate and review is because it is a very small hotel (14 rooms) and it isn't the same as 95% of other hotels I have stayed at. It is fairly unique. So when you are thinking of booking, you need to consider whether things like having a gym on site is important to you. Or whether having a huge breakfast buffet selection is important. Or maybe you want to have a guaranteed sea view or a beach front pool. You can only walk to the shops via the beach (which we found not very clean or pleasant) or via the narrow side streets (where you might not feel very protected from traffic as there are no pavements).

Overall I would rate the hotel as good rather than excellent at this price point. Mainly because of the location/ views. Although it is close

Finally I want to thank Jessica for outstanding customer service. We had a bit of a problem with our first night and when that happens it can sometimes leave you with a negative feeling that is hard to get past. Sometimes things go wrong and when you travel frequently you have to accept that sometimes happens. The sign of good management though is when they recognise a mistake and respond appropriately as happened with Jessica on this occasion.

I hope this review is helpful to future travellers.
title: Funky Pied à Terre in hip and happening Seminyak.

owner_response.text:
Dear Paul P
 
First and foremost thank you for taking the time to post such a comprehensive review. I am very pleased that despite your first night with us, on a whole your Luna2 stay was very enjoyable. I will be sure to pass your comments onto the entire team, as we do aim to deliver superstar service to each of our guests. The staff will be very pleased to know that we were able to exceed your expectations relating to high standard of service.
Regarding your feedback on the all-day room service I am sorry to hear that at the time of your stay, our all-day dining and room service menu was not up to par.  We take this feedback very seriously, and have just recently changed this menu to make it a bit more comprehensive. We will certainly be monitoring all comments on the new menu, as well. Separately, I am pleased to hear your dinner in Orbit restaurant was great.
At Luna2 we pride ourselves with being a unique hotel in many aspects, and we do understand that while being small and ultra-modern, we are not for everyone when they visit Bali. Thank you for your honest review in that matter, as I am sure it will help travellers who might be looking for a more traditional experience.

text: Don't be put off by the location which is at the end of some funky alley way.  Luna 2 is funky and hip and if you are an Austin Powers fan ... you'll swear he'll show up "Baby"..  The gals who work there are in mini dresses and go go boots.  There is art depicting rubix cubes, large Monopoly hotels and houses and funk-a-delic art.  The pool and surrounding area is amazing.  This hotel features a 16 seat movie theater with two different movie showings every day.  You can even order dinner to eat while you watch.  Be sure and go to the Orbit Bar and do not miss trying one of their signature cocktails "Houston, We Have a Problem".  The rooms are just as funky and each has its signature motif.  The beach is a mere 30 second walk and the water was the perfect temperature to dive right in.  The food here is some of the most creative and delicious you will try in all of Bali.  Be sure to ask to meet Head Chef Alana.  Her culinary cuisine expertise will wow your palette.  Also see if you can try the new "In-Flight" meal in your room.  Wonderful and personable staff, close to the beach and a short taxi ride to shopping in Seminyak.  This is a quaint and fabulous hotel and you will be glad you chose the Luna 2.
title: Luna 2 is like reliving in the 60's!!!

text:
After reading the reviews, I was convinced that staying in this hotel will be a good change from the usual Bali villas & resort that I stayed in before but I realized in few hours that it was not for me. 

Pros: 
Clean, modern & new feel to it. 
Loved the music played in the room. 
Martini served on arrival was great.
Closeness to the beach
Service is good. It's what you get in a good hotel but we missed the personal touch we get from service crews in Bali villas 

It felt like it's a good option for a work- business trip. However, I was there for holiday. 

Cons:
It gives you a hotel feel vibe & forget that you are in Bali. It might be great for others, but not for me. 

Breakfast was ok not great. Maybe I had high expectation after reading the reviews. The food looked like it has been outside, displayed for a while.

Swimming pool was un-inviting for me. But i liked the art wall. 

It's a very quiet hotel. I only saw 1 couple during my 5 day stay. 

It's a bit of a walk to everything else except the beach. So we had to use taxi to go mostly everywhere when it was raining or late at night.

Taxis did not know this hotel. But I understand that it's because it's new. 

I was disappointed with the pillows quality & how few of them are available. With the price paid, I expected luxury sheets , pillows & covers. 

I stayed on first floor in a studio called bond on street. 

Overall, I think it's s good studiotel but not for me. I wish the reviews had more details which could've helped me with my decision. Also note that although close to the beach, if you want clean area to lie on the beach, you will need to go towards the neighboring resorts. Also when we walked to the beach, we saw the Luna hotel. Although we didn't go in that hotel, the swimming pool looked more interesting & less inclosed.
title: Good but not for me

text:
My partner and I spent 2 nights at Luna2 Studiotel back in May 2016. Honestly, from the moment we were picked up from the airport (in a brand new mini-van, complete with a range of refreshments), I knew we were in for a treat! Although Luna2 is not what you would expect of Balinese accommodation, it is truly a phenomenal space. The interiors are a fun mish mash of mod, retro, and futurism, with lots of primary colour play. As there are only 14 rooms, you have a fair bit of space to yourself in your room, and you have a great view of the colourful pool from your own private balcony. With it's own cinema, a pool with pool toys, and an underground nightclub, Luna2 is perfect for adults and children (... and big children).

A highlight for me was most definitely the gourmet dinner we had at their restaurant, Orbit. Hotel food has never been that darn good! We had a great choice of wine and cocktails, and the staff were super friendly!

Luna2 is only about a 50m walk to the Seminyak beach front (their private hotel/villa is all that sits between the studiotel and the beach) and it is about a 5 minute drive to the Petitenget area.
title: Out of this world accommodation!

text: My friends and I were looking for a place to chill out for our 25 year reunion, and we stayed at Luna2 villa and hands down, it was the best experience, especially in terms of service level among many other places that we have stayed in previously.  From the moment we stepped out of the plane at the airport, we were greeted by one of the staff to be taken to a car to be brought to the villa, it was top notch service until we left 3 days later.. The manager, Jessica, and the chef, Lana, greeted us upon our arrival and explained everything.  They were really friendly and made sure we were very well taken care of during our stay. The villa was spacious, the pool was amazing. it was beachfront and it's nice to wake up to the view of the beach.., and all the staff that waited on us were polite, friendly, and extremely accommodating.  It was everything that we needed for our reunion.  Breakfast was excellent. Everything comes down to details and Luna2 went far above and beyond our expectations. A few examples: we decided to go out clubbing on our second night and one of us didn't bring a pair of pants, and the manager managed to find a pair of pants for us in 5 minutes!!  We wanted to have something for breakfast that's not on the menu and the chef whipped it up for us.  Dinner reservations were made for us at one of the restaurants that we wanted to go to.  We have a superb and amazing weekend and we can't recommend this place enough and we would definitely come back!
title: WOW... What amazing service!

text:
We stayed at Luna 2 studiotel in a suite with both the view of the ocean and the pool. We were looking for somewhere boutique that was a bit different and this was certainly the case with Luna 2, the decor was quirky but still had an air of luxury about it. I loved the smeg Union Jack fridge and the tv above the bath! I also liked that the room had glassware to use.  I have two distinct memories of our stay at this hotel and these were the personal service we received and the breakfast! ( thanks Linda for all the coffee!) I'm sure if we had dined at the hotel we would have been equally impressed. Sunsets on the rooftop bar were pretty nice too, and if you can, catch a movie in the cinema.  The location of Luna 2 was perfect for the beach being 200m away, and it was an easy walk to Ku De Ta. Seminyak square was a short walk along the streets. The only thing I could fault was that there were no luxury toiletries.
ThankYou to Helmut, Jessica and all the staff for making my husbands 40th celebrations memorable! We would love to come back and stay with the family next time.

text:
Our family of three stayed for seven nights over New Years. We travel a lot and are regular visitors to Bali and know Seminyak well and decided to try the Luna2 Studiotel based on TA and other reviews and the uniqueness of the hotel. 

We found the hotel to be very comfortable, quiet, responsive to guest needs and a very nice place to stay for our entire stay. 

I have dropped one star as; a) an issue arose upon arrival of our son not being allowed to attend NYE at the hotel despite email/s to the contrary prior to arrival which was disapointing & b) our arranged departure transfer using a hotel vehicle was either mixed up or given to another guest/s despite checking the day prior, & c) on our bill we were going to be charged for an arrival transfer (which we used) but also VIP Immigration Service (which we didn't and as regular travellers to the Island is a waste of time and money). To be fair to the hotel, all issues were resolved (we were told just after our son could attend NYE - although when the night came we felt we shouldn't attend the after dinner/fireworks drinks and we went elsewhere, a contractor was contacted and used as our departure transfer understandably at our cost & the bill anomaly was promptly corrected).

That said, we did enjoy our stay and previous positive reviews of the Studiotel we found to be very accurate. The rooms are very quiet, clean and well maintained with multiple cleans each day. The included wifi is excellent in terms of signal strength, consistency and quality.

The location is superb for beach access and about a 20 minute walk from Seminyak Square. The hotel kindly offered the use of a hotel car for quite a few of our dinner and other trip drop offs.

The restaurant (Orbit) is very good; serving three meals a day if required. Breakfast (included) is exceptional, our highlight being the raspberry yoghurt muesli and the ever changing breakfast canapes. The coffee is very good and made to order. Chef Errol prepared us a dinner one evening which was also very good.

The Hotel has an innovative and unique take on room service consistent with the design ethos of the hotel. To be fair we didn't use it a lot and while it perhaps lacks the variety of other larger hotels, for a small and intimate boutique hotel it was certainly adequate. An indonesian option (or a Luna2 fusion of an Indo option or two would have been nice though).

The pool is an excellent size and there's ample shaded spaces and spaces to stretch out and relax. The cinema is also worth a visit; again something unique and a nice place to spend a couple of hours with the family. Service (as one generally finds in Bali) is exceptional.

Our small issues aside, we still recommend the Studiotel for a stay if you are coming to Bali and choose Seminyak as your destination. It's more than a small friendly boutique hotel that offers good levels of service and it's packaged and marketed smartly -something very unique for Bali.
title: Nearly perfect.

text:
Everything you need to know about the hotel BEFORE you come, are as what you've read in the other reviews.  Once you've read these reviews (including mine), cast your expectations and assumptions aside, and just book your stay with the studiotel.  Though personally, I rather you not book at all, cos I rather this be the best-kept secret of Seminyak!  :)

What will bring me back to this studiotel and at the first available opportunity I might add?  The intimacy of the place and the personality of the people who run it.  Everyday they address you and your children by name, and make time to ask you about your day/last night/plans and offer suggestions.  Sure 14-rooms worth of guests ain't a lot of names to go through, but it's the time and effort they make to do so that matters.  
Every parent mentions Ayu in their reviews - I didn't actually engage her world-renowned services, and yet my kids like being around her whenever she's at the lobby!

If you want your holiday to be what a holiday should be - stress-free, relaxing, pampering - this is very much well-worth the money; and yet it's not exactly a very pricey property.  Speaking of pampering - I did ask for the two-way Luna Mobile.  Arriving on day 1, I truly feel pampered - cold towels and a cold drink or two!  However, it was a quiet ride to the airport on our last day.

How stress-free and relaxing?  Breakfast service is officially till 11am, and yet because we are always the last family for breakfast (we arrive no earlier than 10.30!), we never feel rushed to finish even though we're still eating 30mins past 11, and lunch service has to be prepared for.

I must also mention one thing - the service I enjoyed during my stay actually began before I even packed for the trip.  Jessica in particular was already offering me recommendations of where to eat in and around the area.  More importantly for a person who craves connectivity - she helped me get a pre-paid data SIM card weeks before I arrived!

A small suggestion - whilst I should have known better than to place my dirty laundry ON (instead of IN) the laundry basket, the housekeeping team assumed I needed laundry done.  To their credit, laundry service was prompt.  But perhaps, the studiotel should look into having guests drop the laundry chit (which is hung by the side of), into the basket if guests want laundry done. 

On our last day, and with hours to burn after we've officially checked out, we took a dip in the pool.  We got served complimentary granitas - which was a very nice touch on a very muggy day.  More importantly, we were offered the use of a room for a short while to wash up before catching our evening flight home!

Any complaints about this place?  Yes, I do have a big one - I like my popcorn sweet, not salty.  :)

Beyond the studiotel though, and if you're a newbie to Seminyak, be aware that if you're bringing young children here, the beach isn't as pretty or as mild or even as clean as those along say Nusa Dua.  It can be intimidating even - it's the Indian Ocean after all.  But the sunsets here are truly breathtaking.  
If you're looking to head up north towards Seminyak Square (for great food options and shopping - Jessica has great recommendations) or far down south towards Kuta just because), the beach however is a great place to walk along to get to either locations, as opposed to the narrow alleys and roads, where you'll be flirting with Bali's notorious traffic conditions.
title: Feels like you're staying at a friend's place - only the parents are never home!

text: A very quirky 1960's style hotel two minutes walk from the beach at Seminyak. Clean & comfortable with good service and a decent breakfast. This smallish hotel punches above its weight. At the time we stayed it had excellent management in place. It has a small rooftop bar. Try to secure a suite on the top floor, or at the minimum a suite and you shouldn't be disappointed. Personally we wouldn't stay in Seminyak again as there are far more beautiful beaches and places to visit in Bali than there are Seminyak. Although, having said that Seminyak does have some decent restaurants and bars. We found the beach disappointing however. It's big sure, but not that great and there are lot of hustlers who operate the beach sun bed system, which rather spoils it. They are however unrepresentative of Bali people, who we found genuinely friendly & helpful. We stayed 4 days, which really was probably a day too long in Seminyak for us. However, take advantage of the Luna2 complimentary entry to the beach club near Uluwatu. It's  exceptional, and they had reserved sun beds for us. You journey to the beach down a travelator  Lastly, when arriving at the airport ensure that your driver knows exactly where he's going, as ours first tried to drop us off at some dive down an alley. Give your driver the address as well as well as the name of the hotel as there are a couple of other places in Seminyak with similarly named hotels. When you arrive outside the Luna2 Studiotel you may think, oh dear, we're going to be disappointed. But we doubt you will be as the place wins you over. It's worth staying a couple/ few days, but certainly we wouldn't stay longer simply because the hotel was in Seminyak.
title: October 2015

text:
This is a well located, very good hotel with a funky, even weird, motif--all designed around the idea of the 60s, space modules etc. The result is lots of white with primary colours, staff wearing 60s gear (pill box hats, houndstooth check, white PVC boots etc) which is kind of amusing. It does not detract from the main values: good rooms, good staff, good restaurant, great beach side location. 
Jessica Lee, the front office manager is an absolute gold mine of good ideas and help--talk to her.
The pool is surprisingly large for a smaller hotel, big enough for sensible lap swimming, so bring your goggles (you likely can't buy them in Seminyak: well, we couldn't).
The roof top bar is recommended--friendly staff, signature cocktails (Smoked Negroni is an experience as well as a cocktail). One night at least, however, walk along to the Moonlite bar as well. Both are great places to have drinks and see the sun set.
Its an easy taxi ride into town: ask Jessica for recommendations. if you like funky, try the Republik45 ...
We stayed in the room  "Piccadilly on Ground" (the hotel has a MONOPOLY sub theme!)--a  great room with access to the pool etc. BUT, there is a private cinema below and we found the noise too much in the end. They gave us another room without any hassle (example of the good service).

text:
I am very pleased to say that Luna2 Studiotel lives up to its high ratings. We were travelling with our two sons (11 and 15) and while we had previously visited Bali, they hadn't. This chic boutique hotel with only 14 rooms was the final leg of our stay.

We were there for just 2 nights for the Seminyak experience after 3 nights in Jimbaran and 5 nights in the sleepy traditional fishing/diving village of Amed. 

The hotel is visually brilliant with its combination of Mondrian-Monopoly-Warhol-Lichtenstein touches. 10 out of 10 for service, friendliness and food. It's just a few metres walk to the beach, although even though Bali has its new "clean and green" policy going, the city beaches still can't compete with the Aussie ones, although there is a whole lot of action down there and the kids loved it.
 
The rooms are very quirky and well set up. The only comment is that I thought creating a mini-bar situation to buy toothpaste, mouth wash etc was a bit of a stretch considering the price of the rooms. My son couldn't find his toothpaste and had to buy a $3 tube. Since we were a family of 4, we had to have two rooms. We took the Sunset Suite, but we decided that we also really liked the kids' room which was the standard suite.

Finally, the downstairs private theatre. After a week in the water in Amed with virtually no technology, we were happy for the boys to indulge in a movie and play a bit of X-Box on the big screen with super-comfy recliner chairs and service from DeeDee - the cherry on our Bali cake. 

I wanted have a few different Bali experiences with my family and the Luna2 Studiotel is about as far from traditional Bali as you can get. It was the perfect finish to our trip. Jessica was also incredibly helpful and in-the-know, she was able to point us towards some fabulous restaurants - including Republik 1945 - which we all loved.
title: Slightly out of this world luxury

text:
Now this is not your "run of the mill hotel" experiences. Navigation was a bit tough (it is in main Seminyak and very close to 4 Seasons, for future travellers) and the main entrance actually looks a bit like a side entrance, but upon entering, we were in for several consecutive surprises. The welcome drink was an excellent cocktail, the initial "meet and greet" was very nice and homely and we actually got to watch a movie "gold class" while the babysitter took care of our little dude (Ayu is the best babysitter we have ever met, period!). First time I had a fantastic Bloody Mary while watching a movie in a cinema hall:):). 

A paragraph about the food. We've had breakfast spread in quite a few hotels.This was probably the best and most delicious my wife and I have ever eaten till date (yes actually that good)! Their fish "main course" was the best fish i have ever had and my only request is for Luna2 Studiotel to add some dishes as choices in "a la carte" are too few. 

To top it all up, the walk from the hotel to the market is wonderfully haunted and quite safe. My wife and i had a great time walking at 12am in semi dark alleys:):). 

Beds was incredibly comfortable to the point where we simply didn't want to get up in the morning. Most comfortable pillows we've ever slept on and if we had larger bags would've carried at least one with us without any shame..:) 

Wifi was quite good.

The staff is excellent and very well trained and our sendoff was again very personal and homely. Definitely recommending for a visit to one and all, please try Luna2 Studiotel and you will not be disappointed.
title: Quirky, superb and absolutely worth the experience

text:
We stayed for two days in two adjoining rooms, my parents and I. Colour themed rooms full of quirky items and art.
Very quiet hotel with impeccable service. Great food, also during breakfast. Loved the design pool and due to the small scale of the hotel you have the pool often to yourself.
Service is VERY personal. This is the way this lovely hotel distincts itself from the other Seminyak properties.
I was there with my almost 70 year old parents who were afraid that they would be to old for such a funky place, but they they did not feel out of place at all due to the very nice and accommodating staff. Will definitely come again.

text: When we arrived we were met by staff wearing 1970s star trek style dresses offering cool towels and a good cocktail.  I think nearly every member of staff eventually introduced themselves to us over our five day stay.  The bright décor is well thought out with hints at space travel and the game of Monopoly in the public areas. The large bedrooms were beautifully furnished and thought had been given to the contents of the fridge and spare toiletries that we may have been forgotten.  The cooked breakfasts were wonderful and the options of vegetable or fruit drinks meant we could pretend we were being healthy some days.  We loved the small cinema in the basement with our drinks and popcorn and cocktails on the roof watching sunset. We also enjoyed a five course degustation menu on the roof where thought was given to fun presentation and great flavours.  The small pool area was a quiet place to flop in between visits to various bars, restaurants and shopping. A lovely break.
title: Fantastic boutique hotel for young couples or friends

text:
Booking a trip is not a simple experience for me - I spend hours researching trying to find the best place. Luna2 is listed as the best hotel in Seminyak for a reason. It is absolutely flawless.. 

The decor is different than any other hotel, very quirky and cool! The staff were friendly and attentive when you needed them. Very thoughtful down to the last detail, getting us a coffee to go when we were heading out and missing breakfast or a cold bottle of water to take on a shopping trip in the afternoon. We arrived to a cocktail and chocolates and a cold face cloth, and they would bring out cold face cloths mid day every day if you are sat by the pool. Relaxing poolside could not be simpler, you have to press a button and one of the amazing staff can bring you cocktails, lunch, whatever you need. 

Breakfast is exceptional, including breakfast canapés, fresh fruit, juices, pancakes, coffee - perfect! 

We even tried the "in flight" dining one night where we had room service which is wheeled into the room in a space age silver cabinet and presented on trays, very different and beautiful food as always. 

The room was equipped with everything we could need, a small Smeg fridge with lots of drinks & snacks and a bathroom 'mini bar' with anything you might have forgotten. Huge shower and a bath with a TV above for relaxing. The rooms are cleaned twice a day. 

We had cocktails at Space a few times, and watched the sunset over the water. Once again just PERFECT, relaxed vibe. When we got back to our room one night we had some chilled music playing on the iPod dock, lights set to the mood & a water jug and glasses set out for our return. They honestly think of everything. We were so sad to leave and will definitely be back! 

I can't see anyone being disappointed with Luna2!
title: Perfect!

text:
Luna2 Studiotel is by far the most fabulous home-away-from-home ky husband and I have ever had the pleasure of staying.  We were in residence there for 3 fab weeks, and our family joined us for a week for a post wedding celebration. We took over their amazing villa and the hotel for that week. It worked a treat and everyone loved it. Perfect location, beautifully designed and super fun.
The staff are all wonderful in every way, always very welcoming and never not sporting a happy face. Nothing was ever too much trouble. Guest‪+61 415 681 013‬ relations crew, Jessica and Helmet , were fantastic.  The chef is fab, breakfasts were delicious and the food in general was great.
We enjoyed watching a movie on a couple of occasions in the private cinema and we had a super fun night in private club downstairs.
Their attention to detail is very impressive. In all the time we were there we could not pinpoint a single flaw.
The roof top bar is a super spot to enjoy a cocktail (they make very good ones!) to catch a sunset, and the restaurant is a choice spot to enjoy lunch or dinner no matter if you are not staying at the hotel.
We have and will continue to recommend this wonderful hub to anyone and everyone.
Thank you, guys, for a truly memorable stay. See you back there soon!

text:
This is the only place you need to stay in Seminyak if you want an Oasis free from the chaos.  

How about the style of the place?  As the brochure says it's the vision of the future as seen from the 60's.  Think The Jetsons, the golden era of 1st class flying, Carnaby street, a little Austin Powers and a big dose of Andy Warhol pop art!  You can find plenty of clubs in Bali, plenty of uber luxurious hotels etc, but you won't find any place cooler than this hotel... it's just fun to be in and I've already decided the next house I build is going to have a Mondrian finish in the pool. Awesome! ;-)
How about the food?  So so good... 1st class chefs, cooking food as good as any hotel and better than many restaurants (Balinese and Western).

The cocktails?  Spot on, super tasty, creative... worth the price tag!

Guest services?  Could not be more attentive, from the in house Nanny Ayu (who is the first person my wife has ever trusted with our 18m old son, she was amazing), the hookups for dining, tours etc, the friendly genuine conversation and interest in our comfort and well being every day from each and every staff member... it's truly spot on!  I honestly wish I was able to thank each of you personally on our checkout.

It's a boutique hotel ok, there's only 14 rooms so there's on gym, no onsite spa etc etc but it's got a great pool, brilliant rooms, great food and drink and a couple of funky onsite bars that are both great!  So... if you plan to get out and about whilst in Bali... you'll be so happy come home to Luna2 each night!
title: The coolest little hotel in Seminyak!

Melanie Hall, Luna2 Founder & Designer will be delighted that you have found inspiration in her design into your next home! What better way to remember your memories with your 18-month old son on holidays then re-creating the pool from Luna2!  You must send us pictures when the time comes. 

While we do not have a gym, we do have sports instructors who come on-site for training and we offer complimentary access to Canggu club, which has a gym and tennis courts. text: We chose Bali for our daughters wedding in June.  The location was very convenient for our guests who came from Australia, Hong Kong and London where our daughter has lived.  All 14 Studios were filled with some of the guests and it was a hectic fun and busy week.  ALL the staff are simply amazing, from pick up at the airport, reception,  beautiful cocktail on arrival, unpacking all our luggage and simply handling everyones requests no matter what!   It is hard to compare with any other 5 star hotel or so called boutique hotels, it is unique in every way.  The quality of produce which is sourced daily and the executive chefs supervising a large staff to ensure that every guests food experience is fabulous.  The eating options are various from a beautiful cool funky restaurant, pool side dining and roof top terrace where sunset drinks are an absolute must!  The design and layout of the whole property makes you feel like your the only guests there.  There is a basement nightclub called POP which is staffed by a very competent mixologist and the music is Euro standard.  In case you want a quiet night you can laze in a 16 seat come lounge chair/bed and watch the latest of every movie on a theatre sized screen munching on burgers, hot dogs and popcorn and any required beverage.   Highly recommended
title: Wedding of Tegan and Adam Waters

We had a fabulous experience at Luna2, so much so, we were planning our next visit before we left.  The design is a refreshing change from the norm, the staff are fantastic and friendly, the food and drinks are delightful (try the pancakes for breakfast) and the whole atmosphere invites you to relax and enjoy! 

Most has pretty much been said before, so I shall not repeat, however there is one thing I would like to add - we had to reschedule our first booking (made through an online booking site) due to the volcanic ash cloud - it could not have been simpler or easier (our travel insurance was not going to assist, so it could have been far worse).  I think we had a reply within the hour (possibly less) about changing our booking - this was 5* as far as I am concerned given the confusion over flights etc.

text:
Luna 2 Studiotel… where do we start!

First thing is first, the breakfast…amazing. We chose the complimentary breakfast option with our eight night booking. We did not realise this meant a custom made breakfast, with juice, unlimited coffee, sweets, fruit etc. Much better than any buffet!

The hotel is positioned down a laneway maybe 50m back from the beach. Some of the key highlights for us were.

•	Jess was an amazing hostess (hostess with the mostest!), always checking to see how we found our stay. Asking what we were doing and suggesting places for us to eat and drink. Our preference is good quality and well priced food  - Jess worked this out pretty quickly and directed us to some great places.
•	Helmut knows his stuff when it comes to drinks and places to visit. Legend!
•	The retro design of the hotel is pretty cool and unique, it makes Luna life interesting!
•	Drinks on the rooftop at sunset cannot be missed! We did this a couple of times.
•	Arif (staff member) looked after me when I was sick (manflu!), with complimentary ginger tea with honey and Berocca. I am very grateful for the support!
•	Rooms are very spacious and the bed was incredibly comfortable – there’s even a pillow menu.
•	The pool is the perfect size for a smaller hotel, always kept clean, they even come around and clean your sunglasses while you relax!

Improvements
-	Really, really hard to critique here! Can’t say we can think of any at all.

This is THE place to stay in Seminyak, do it.

We will be back again soon, without a doubt!

Matt & Kirsty
title: Location, TICK! Amazing food, TICK! unbeatable service, TICK! YOU MUST GO!

text: I've stayed in Seminyak several times over the years and have done the usual Bali-style villas and the grand hotels which are all great.  But then I experienced Luna 2 Studiotel and was blown away.  It is by far the coolest place in Bali from the roof top bar to the funkiest night club but more importantly, it does all the other stuff so well; the service is nothing short of amazing, with a dedicated and quite glamorous team who treat every guest with such care and attention you won't want to leave.   The design ethos is so different for Bali but still feels authentic and luxurious.  Created by design guru Melanie Hall, I noticed a different and wonderful detail every day.  It is bright and bold with a strong modernist ethos, but also extremely comfortable and luxurious.  The rooms are nothing short of stunning with huge mini bars (maxi bars) and the most comfortable beds.  They are so well designed and interesting, it's hard to leave in the morning, but then you remember the delicious poached egg and avocado on rye and a glass of champagne waiting for you at breakfast.  I couldn't recommend it more highly.
title: The excellent service matches the outstanding design and amazing attention to detail.  A breath of fresh air to Bali.

text:
From the moment we walked through the door we were treated like royalty.  That is hard to pull off for a boutique hotel.  Luna2 did it with style and class.  From the wonderful decor to the amazing food and drinks this place has it all, and that's saying something for one of the only hotels on the beach with it's private section of beach.  Watching the sunset from the rooftop bar which offers a mouthwatering list of refreshments that include Oysters, Caviar and champagne martinis.  This place was one of if not the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

I have to add that the staff went a long way towards making that a reality.  Kind, understanding, helpful, considerate, generous, it's hard to go on and not sound like a broken record with corporate sponsorship, but it is true.  This is both affordable and enjoyable, cool and classy, comfortable and stylish.

The food was amazing, breakfast every morning was a highlight of the day.  It's been a long time since I had had an English fry up that good. Strolling along the beach was incredibly relaxing and so easy as I mentioned its a stones throw...

Jessica and Helmut, thank you so much, you guys made it really special.  We have stayed in our share of bouquet and five star hotels but that trip takes the cake.  Thank you again for making ti so wonderful.

We hope to see you again,

I look forward to bringing a group of friends and staying at the private hotel.  While it would be hard as the Studiotel is still so good.  How can you pass up a private sunset with not Air Asia umbrellas in Sieminyak.
title: So fresh and so clean... this place has it all with staff as amazing as the Marilyn Manroe mosaic from Italy.

text:
After driving through a super narrow road, there it was- the Luna2! We were greeted lovely by numerous staff with babysitter Ayu introducing herself as the babysitter and being part of the service so we could have dinners just the 2 of us! She was absolutely brilliant and we surely used her a lot. This hotel only has 14 rooms plus the adjacent villa but a lovely playroom ( unlike the W which has 100s of rooms and no area for children...) this room could be a little better lit but apart from this little remark, this hotel could not be better, funkier and the service could not be better. Decor everywhere is superb and unique, rooms are spacious and clean with a maxibar instead of a minibar( meaning a Smeg frige filled with proper sizes bottles and a wide selection) and we had a private cinema viewing in their own little cinema which could not be better either: funky design, comfortable rocking sofas that can be extended to be bed like. Popcorn from a retro popcorn machine, cuddly blankets. 
Food was amazing too! For breakfast there is a lovely selection on the buffet plus an a la carte choice, fresh juices and coffee. 
Like everywhere in Bali, hotels do not have private beaches, the beach which is 2 walking minutes away, has dark shimmering sand and is clean, nice busy but rough- which is good I suppose when you're a surfer:)

All staff was amazing, helpful, friendly, switched on, quick and efficient. Nothing more to say- we had a perfect stay here and would go back without question.
title: Babysitter included

text:
We spent 5 nights here in July 2015.

Managers Helmut and Jess were friendly and helpful and came to say chat with us every day. Helmut even pretty much planned a whole day of sightseeing for us with personal recommendations of his favourite places to go to and Jess offered complimentary late check out on our last day which was great as our flight was in the evening. 

The Studiotel is relatively new and has so many fun design features, everywhere you look there is something fun and surprising. There was also an iPod with music in the bedroom with playlists for different times of the day like 'breakfast', 'brunch', 'mid afternoon' and 'party' which we enjoyed!

Luna2 is located at the end of a narrow winding road right near the beach, we found some taxi drivers had difficulty finding it so we showed them the location on a map rather than the address. There is a "Luna 2 Navigator" which has a map of the Studiotel which you can show them. 

Luna2 is within a 5 minute walk of the beach and Ku De Ta, and within a 10 minute taxi ride of places such as the W Hotel, Potato Head, Bambu & La Lucciola so it is a great base for exploring Seminyak.

We would recommend this place if you're looking for something different from the usual Bali villa style accommodation and a more intimate hotel experience. Big thumbs up!!!
title: The personal touch!

text:
So many people have given you what you need to know about the quirky / retro design features of this hotel that I can't really add anything - so instead I'm going to focus entirely on the staff because they are the magic ingredient that takes this building from simply being bricks and mortar to being a vibrant, personable, engaging, stimulating and fun place to stay! Helmut our Austrian host is an absolute star - striking a balance between getting to know you and giving you the space and local knowledge you want to indulge yourself in the many wonderful experiences a place like Seminyak has to offer. Throw in the fact that he's an award winning mixologist and you have yourself a first rate host who can make a massive contribution to you holiday experience. He referred us to El Kabron and got us seats in the VIP section to indulge in cocktails whilst watching a stunning sunset. He referred us to Republik 45 - the best Indonesian food and all round dining experience you could hope to find here. And more importantly for us celebrating our wedding anniversary he arranged for us to eat dinner at the hotels private villa next door facing the beach under the direction of Errol the Head Chef.

And that brings me to the food at the hotel - Errol, originally from London, has worked under Gordon and Raymond - two of the most easily recognisable Chefs out there today. In doing so he has clearly mastered a range of cooking styles - but more importantly he's a very down the earth and likeable guy who takes the time to get to know you a bit so that he can give you the sort of dining experience that will rock your world. At our private dinner he made so many different flavour combinations come to life, introducing little twists with the presentation, explaining a little bit about the techniques used  and even where the food is sourced from. As a double act he and Helmut are formidable and you get a sense that they enjoy working with one another - pushing each other to outdo themselves time and again.

Then there's front of house where we met Jess, a really genuine Aussie girl, who makes life so much easier for you during your stay - she has clearly made it her business to get to know the local area and can hook you up with any number of places to go sight seeing or for food / shopping etc. Jess is one of those people, who end up feeling like you've known for ages after only just meeting her. She treats you the way she would expect and like to be treated at a hotel of this stature and you can't really ask for anything else.

As for the rest of the staff - from the security guys on the door or at the beach corner, to the waiting staff in the restaurant and bar, to the cleaning and maintenance staff - all are so friendly and so helpful that you can't help but think about the training they have received and how well they have bought into the philosophy of excellence that this small hotel aspires to embody. At the end of the day it's a cool boutique hotel but what makes it seem like it's come from nowhere to stand toe to toe with other local more established heavyweights are its amazing staff. They gave us the best holiday experience both inside and outside of the hotel that we've ever had, and whilst we are sad to be leaving we will do whatever we can to ensure that others give them the chance to show how good they can be! A huge and very sincere thanks to all the staff at Luna2 - you guys rock!
title: Outstanding in every way!

text:
I had a great stay in Luna2 studiotel. The hotel itself was beautiful. If you're looking for hotel that is fun and exciting, this is the one. Every room was nicely designed by their British designer owner. I love how it is simply different than other hotels and villas in Bali. The interior design are absolutely colorful. I love how everything seems so personalize and private. With limit amount of rooms, they make sure to bring high quality service to you. LunaPlex private movie theater and Space bar were my favorite. If you just wanted to stay in for a lazy day, there are plenty options for you to enjoy your time. 
However there are few things that you should know before checking in. If you are someone who really cares about breakfast sanctification. This hotel is not buffet style. They do offer delicious food. However breakfast options are really minimal. Breakfast is continental style. Free Breakfast will not fill you up, but there are a list of options you could choose from for additional charge with reasonable price. Another thing that you should be aware, this hotel is new and not a lot of people know about it yet ! So I had taxi drivers having problem sending me to the right location even with the address in hand. It is right next to the beach so it is a bit far away from where all thing local shops are. 
Overall being 10 the highest I would give this hotel a 8.5. I really enjoyed by stay, every corner there's going to be some thing that surprise you. It was just such a FUN FUN stay !
title: Thumbs up for this "Fun Fun Hotel" !
