It is great to read you had a fun and enjoyable stay at Luna2 studiotel. Melanie Hall, Luna2 founder & designer will be pleased to read your comments on the design. I will be sure to pass on your words to the staff regarding our delivery of high service. It sounds as though you got to experience all that Luna2 has to offer, and you are right in saying that for anyone wanting a relaxing lazy day without having to leave the hotel, we have it covered with watching a film in Lunaplex cinema and having a cocktail in Space roof top bar while watching the sunset. 

We appreciate your feedback our breakfast offering, as you mentioned because we have only fourteen rooms we do not have a traditional large buffet on offer. However, with nearly all of our bookings, guests that have breakfast included – from the extensive range of bite size options on the buffet, to the a la carte meals from the Orbit breakfast menu, which can be anything from corn fritters, pancakes, full English breakfast or any style of eggs. I do apologise if this was not clear to you, but nearly all of our guests enjoy daily complimentary breakfast, complete with coffee and tea. 

At Luna2 we understand some taxi drivers may be confused with our location, and we do our best to provide the location via GoogleMaps, as well as directions from the airport on our website. We will be sure to make this more clear to future guests. We also provide maps that identify our location and all of the shops and restaurants that are within close proximity in the heart of Seminyak. 

Thank you for staying with us, and for taking the time to write a review. 

We hope to see you back at Luna2 for another cosmic stay. 

Jessica Lee Cook
Front Office Manager

text:
We had a great stay of 6 days at Luna2 studiotel during our honeymoon. The rooms are fantastic: lots of space, nicely designed with well thought out details, modern and clean. With a small kitchenette, Nespresso coffee maker and laundry service, they are suited for even a longer stay. The staff was very friendly and attended to all our needs.

A couple of times we also had a quick lunch in Orbit restaurant at the hotel, which serves high quality western style food that can also be delivered by the pool or your room. For a more local dining experience there is plenty of options within a short taxi drive or walk through the (rather narrow) streets of Seminyak.

Unlike the neighboring Luna2 private hotel, studiotel is not directly at the beach, but just a 50 meters of pedestrian way away.

The lovely pool was directly accessible from our studio and provides a peaceful environment for relaxation with shaded sunbeds with food and drinks only a button press away.

This is a beautiful hotel, but don't take my word for it – just stay here once and soon you will be waiting for your next visit!
title: Stay in Seminyak with style

text: My boyfriend and I had a two night stay at Luna2 Studiotel. The moment we arrived we were welcomed with complimentary chocolates and Lunatini drinks. The staff were warm, welcoming and pleasant. The room was large and fully equipped with modern day amenities, iPod, Satellite TV, mini bar, Kitchenette and iPad. Our room was on the first floor giving us easy access to the lap pool. My boyfriend and I planned to explore the night life but the bed was so comfortable it sucked us in. We had really good sleep! We wanted to hit the gym and so we decided to give a try to Canggu Club. Luna2 gave us two platinum cards and to go coffee for Canggu Club. It was VIP treatment. Luna2 Studiotel has a roof top bar overlooking Seminyak beach. The cocktails here are top notch. We ordered two old fashioned cocktails and enjoyed a magnificent sunset. Complimentary breakfast was delicious and filling. Compliments to the chef. We had a fabulous time here.
title: Slept like a baby!

locations.name: Luna2 Seminyak by Premier Hospitality Asia
Luna2 Seminyak by Premier Hospitality Asia

text:
I cant begin to say how amazing this hotel was. My wife and I stayed in Luna 2 for the final two nights of our honeymoon about two weeks ago. We arrived pretty early (11am) and straight away we were made feel genuinely welcome by Jess and the guys on reception and even the chef Erol. Despite us arriving early, by the time we had our welcoming cocktails (which were amazing ) drank, our room was ready. 

We saw some of the photos before hand but they do not do the place justice.  The multiple TV's, popart, huge selection of drinks in the SMEG fridge....IPAD, TV in the bath, cinema downstairs with lazyboy chairs...the list just goes on and on and i could write about ten paragraphs about the decor and the cool quirky stuff because it is all amazing,  but just check out the photos. The thing that really makes this place stand out is the service.

We have been to many hotels over the years, some a lot more expensive than this and supposedly better ...But none of them come close to the service here. Several other reviews have said this, and its true...nothing is too much trouble. The staff chat away with you and are always making sure that you are looked after and ok without being intrusive. 

On our first night, we said we would have dinner in the hotel restaurant,  expecting it to be the regular, run of the mill, sit down, look at the menu and order......Nope!!!
while sitting by the pool, Chef Allanah, who is unbelievably lovely, came out to talk to us to get a feel for what type of things we both liked (which is great because i am very fussy). Later on that evening after the drinks reception on the roof, watching the sun go down, we sat for dinner. To our absolute amazement and delight, we were the only ones in the restaurant that evening so it became obvious that we were getting a personally cooked meal. Before the meal Allanah presented the menu to us, which sounded amazing and also before each course she came to tell us exactly what the dish was and how it was cooked (it was like an episode of Masterchef -The professionals...of course). Both of us had completely different courses, except desert and start to finish it was the nicest meal i have had to date!!! 

All in all, It really made the last two days of our honeymoon very special. i would recommend this hotel to anyone, number one- its not expensive and number two- there are only 14 rooms so it feels so personal.

Thank you so much everyone

John & Fiona
title: Just Book It!!

text:
We arrived late (1am) after some flight and taxi delays, and still Errol, the chef of the evening was able to put on an impressive dinner for us weary travellers.
The location is excellent, 1 house (by house we mean the self contained Luna pad) back from the beach.  Easy walking distance to shopping and dining if you ever choose not to dine at Luna2, this place is great - great pool, great room, great food, and even greater staff, who go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable.  Ayu the in house nanny looked after our 18month old for 2 evenings, this was just such an excellent service to have, as you really want to know when you go out, your child is well looked after, after all, sometimes you do need a little break from them as well...
A word of warning - this hotel is new, and taxi drivers can have trouble finding it, so taking a map to show them the location is a good idea - it's not in the traditional 'hotel' area.
title: Stunning getaway

text: The hardest part of writing this review is the feeling of giving away a special secret. It's one of those finds that you want to keep to yourself but know it's not fair to the amazing team at Luna2 & the incredible space, both of which combine to make this an experience like no other. From the moment you walk through the big white door, it's like being Alice in Wonderland going down the Rabbit Hole. The confidence & commitment to design a hotel like this that doesn't follow the rules has won us over. This place is far from your average hotel, especially in Bali. The intimacy created by the wonderful team with Jessica & Helmut in charge is so welcoming & refreshing. Every staff member knows your name & nothing is too much trouble. They even clean your sunglasses when lazing around the pool in your own private daybed. The cocktails at Space Rooftop Bar are the best we have had anywhere in the world. You have to try their Negroni. Everything is done with a smile & a warm greeting. My husband & I have just enjoyed a 6 night stay in the Strand Suite. I could keep going forever, & giveaway all of their secrets, but you need to come & stay at this amazing place so you can find out the rest for yourselves. We will definitely be staying at Luna2Studiotel on our next visit to Bali. Thank you to all the team that made our visit here truly memorable.

text:
It took me sometime to write this review, but I feel as if I got to tell the world how wonderful this hotel is! We stayed here for just 2 days after working in Bali for 5 months. And it was absolutely nothing like we expected! I have stayed in many hotels all over asia and europe and I must say, non of the hotels I have been to, could surprise me like this one did! 
We had the Sunset Studio, one of a kind with a wonderful view over the ocean and a faboulous design! On our first night we didn't want to leave the hotel!
We had some Drinks at the Space bar, to our amusement they had the Pisco Sour which you can't get around here. We enjoyed the free canapes and watched the sun set. 
Then, we had the cinema all to our self and could choose a movie to watch. The club is cool too! We also had dinner, and honestly, I was blown away! The Chef came out, talket with us 5 minutes and created a amazing menu! She is living her dream cooking out of her head for her guests! you should definetly try their restaurant! 
Needless to say, the staff is amazing, calling you by names and treating you like an old friend. If you are looking for a different experience than a traditional balinese hotel, this is the NR.1 you should be going to! If in Bali again-100% this hotel!
title: Absolutely amazing!

text:
I always check trip advisor before booking a hotel. When I read the reviews for Luna2 I almost didn't believe them. How could a hotel be this amazing??

Well it is! From the cold drinks and towels in the Lunamobile from the airport to the free (super high quality) babysitting, to the movie theatre and Pop club in the basement. The design is super chic, but it's the concept and the staff that make this place special. 

We went as a family (two kids 3 and 1) with my sister and her husband.  Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. They made anything my kids wanted to eat and set up toys and a high chair in the Space rooftop bar so they could eat dinner and we could enjoy the sunset.

Ayu, the babysitter, was  outstanding with my two, and helped me feel at ease about leaving them to grab dinner in the evening.

The general manager was fantastic, he stopped by to see us everyday and ensured we had tables booked and transport arranged.

Nothing was too much trouble! I especially loved them coming by to clean your sunglasses at the pool!

Hands down the best hotel I have ever stayed at. We've been in Asia for three years and stayed at many wonderful places but this is on par with Nikoi (for those of you who have been there) obviously a very different concept and experience, but the quality and service is right up there!!

Can't wait to go back :)
title: Everything you dreamed of....and more!

owner_response.text:
Dear Monts79
 
Greetings from Luna2 studiotel in Bali.  Thank you for taking time to post such a complimentary review. I will be sure to pass on your gratitude to Ayu, she certainly is fantastic with the children.

text:
Luna2 is a fantastic place, in an amazing location, and a bit of a trip in its own right... Strikes a really great note between high style and warm welcome. We arrived via the space-shuttle-ish van service Luna provides from the airport, were greeted by name by the entire really sweet staff, and had a late dinner downstairs, just after checking in, that oddly made our weekend - no menu, just a quick chat with the chef, and then best meal in 6 months in Indo... still grateful for that. 

Our room and view were great, if even more Sputnik than we needed - go for the upper floors if you can. There's a lot of design going on, but I actually liked the overall architecture as much as all the Pop details - it's a really well-thought out place. The space and game theme had our 8-year old captivated immediately, from Monopoly, everywhere, to Mondrian in the pool, and I wish I had caught a movie in the theater below. And the surf 100' away is great - my first barrel in Bali - though I may wait for dry season for more there. Hope to be back soon.
title: Supercool Getaway

text: I stayed at the Luna2 at the end of my 2 week vacation in Bali.. we were welcomed by Jessica and the rest of the staff at the hotel with a warm welcome and a glass of fine champagne... so off to a great start... when we were cooled down from our travel from Ubud we were escorted to our rooms where we literally dropped our jaws on the floor... With a retro musically inspired vibe, but modern at the same time and spacious we knew we had saved the best hotel for the last of our journey... The attention to detail was impressive, from the iPad which was available to use for guests which also outlines all facilities and menus for the hotel, to the Barrocca vitamin pills useful after a night out in seminyak. The beds were comfortable and the best part is the hotel is peaceful but perfectly located to the city, the beach and has its own private pool where you are secluded from the scooters of Bali.. The staff were amazing, Leslie took time out to share a cocktail with us on the rooftop, Jessica was always on point to remind us of what was happening that night in the area and giving advise on where to eat and drink and Helmut the food and beverage manager knew exactly what we needed at any given time of the day including amazing Bloody Mary's at breakfast! I would highly recommend this hotel. If you are looking for a modern feel, some peace and quiet but also with the possibility to hit the town, or go for some local shopping or food Luna2 is the place!
title: PERFECT LOCATION, FRIENDLIEST STAFF AND FANTASTIC SERVICE

text:
This place was amazing. It wasn't too over the top or cheesy as I feared.  I wont go on about it, just read all the other reviews as there are all spot on. We had a sunset dinner arranged for us at the rooftop bar, it was beautiful. and great with kids as you get to enjoy beautiful food with an amazing view without needing to arrange babysitters or drag your kids around town. They will make whatever food you want for your kids.  We had inter-connecting rooms. The kids loved the pool, cinema, mini (maxi) bar, the tv in the bath, the lego and monopoly decor. We loved the food and the service.  Its not really a normal family hotel I suppose but we were very comfortable there.  Although we couldn't afford to stay too long as once you start getting inter-connecting rooms the price adds up, even with discounted rates. We used the free pass to splash waterpark, it wasn't that great for our aged kids (5 and 7) but it was a fun afternoon out and it was good to check it out.

The only minor issue I had, which was my fault,  was that I managed to look myself out on the balcony. Fortunately my husband was in the pool and could come and rescue me. Not sure how I did it as you need to have the door in the lock position for it to happen, but somehow I managed it. 

We would definitely return. Thanks for a great stay.
title: all the good reviews on here are true

text:
I am writing this review after my second stay at Luna2. 

A re-routed flight meant I had to spend one night in Bali before carrying on to Sydney - I landed with a broken phone and no access to the Internet. Based on my previous experience at Luna2 I refused to consider staying anywhere else so got a taxi to the resort. Fortunately for me Jessica (Front Office Manager) was on reception and recognised me immediately and came around the counter for a hug - a welcome end to a 72 hour journey and the kind of personal touch that makes Luna2 stand out.

Having explained my situation I was whisked off to the roof top bar for a few complimentary drinks and canapés with the GM while my room was prepared. After the original disappointment of a rerouted flight by this point I couldn't have been happier to be in Bali!

The room was a suite and incredible, which I have come to expect rather than hope for. 

The levels of staff service remained the same, everyone remembered my name and all asked about the wellbeing of my partner - I was especially looked after by Adi and Windu who feel more like friends than hotel staff!

Since my last trip Luna2 have hired a new, experienced chef with a CV that includes a number of award winning and Michelin starred restaurants in London. Erroll was a brilliant hire who, despite my high expectations, actually delivered better food than previously and he insisted on tracking me down and sharing a few beers with me when he knew I was travelling alone and up for a good time! I considered going above and beyond his duty, the fact his company was so enjoyable was an added bonus. 

I won't be surprised when Luna2 becomes the Number One rated hotel in Seminyak - it's only a matter of time so I would advise to book now while they still have availability. I wouldn't typically write such a stellar review out of fear of the prices going up so much (!) but the quality and service of the staff, hotel and amenities means that I would be doing them a disservice in not doing so.

I look forward to seeing everyone there again soon.

Regards, 
Shaun
title: Blown away for the second time!

So it might be the coolest hotel in Bali.  First off - it is immaculate, and exceptionally clean.  Moreover, the whole place is so well designed you won't believe it.  My wife and I booked the sunset balcony room, and were wowed by the room.  The location is also unbeatable - a 5 minute walk not he beach to Ku-De-Ta and surf / beach bumming at your doorstep.

We did have some real issues with our A/C - but the hotel did everything possible to fix quickly, and they did make it right in the end.

A highlight of our visit was Jessica, the insanely friendly and patient manager that helped our hand through issues, as well as surf lessons.  Jessica was always smiling, and I can honestly say that she is a huge part of why I recommend this place. 

Don't bother looking around - this is the spot! Ask for Jessica!

text:
This has to be the best, most interesting place I have ever stayed. The Bond-style decor is incredible and small touches, like champagne on arrival (served by a 1960s air hostess) and an iPod loaded with 60s tunes in the room, made the stay even more surreal. The huge room was also complete with a free iPad for use during the stay, perfect for lazing by the colourful pool. 

Staff were so friendly and welcoming - they really went out of their way to ensure your stay was perfect. Drinks at the Sunset Bar were complimented with tiny, delicious canapés. Breakfast was a feast of delights and all served with a smile.

I could not recommend this hotel more. It was a complete experience and not what you would expect from Bali. It felt like a weird and wonderful time capsule away from the hectic streets of Seminyak. Do yourself a favour and book a room!

text:
We stayed at Luna2 for six nights and it was hands down the best hotel we have stayed in, in terms of uniqueness, size of room, quality and availability of amenities and service of staff. We arrived late on a Saturday evening and instead of arrival drinks we had a warm flask of hot chocolate and home made cookies in our room waiting for us. Amazing!

The hotel itself is a clean and modern presentation of the British Pop Art culture; I half expected the Beatles to walk around the corner any minute or find myself in the middle of a magazine shoot. The owner has kept a very close eye on the smallest of details and you might not appreciate them until you leave to your next hotel; something as simple as international plug sockets next to sink basins (as well as Indonesian plugs) was appreciated and designed with international and local clientele in mind. 

The pool area was peaceful and pleasant and less than a five minute walk to the beach. Location wise the hotel is right in the middle of Seminyak, a five minute walk down the beach to Ku De Ta and ten minutes to Potato Head however once you are inside the resort it feels like it is just you and ocean; truly peaceful.

As food lovers from Sydney we have unreasonably high expectations of our food but ate at Luna most days due to the extraordinary creations from Brandon the Australian chef whose food competes with the finest restaurants in Sydney. Particularly recommend is his truffle and mushroom soup. Brandon was also a great source of recommendations for some of the lesser known places to eat in Bali ensuring that when we did leave the resort we only experienced the very best at reasonable prices.

The roof deck bar is a must and perfect for cocktails and beers watching the sunset between 6-8pm. I'd also recommend the cinema and night club for late night activities where services (drinks and popcorn or a blanket) are only at the push of a button away.

Finally the service; we really did feel like A-List stars at this place, I cannot speak highly enough of Jessica who went above and beyond what we would expect of a Front Office Manager; a lovely person genuinely interested in making your stay in Bali (not just her hotel) as memorable as possible. The guests are outnumbered by staff which makes you feel truly pampered, and literally everyone knows and remembers your name giving the stay a 'personal feel'. Special mentions to Aki, Wundi and Brandon who became more like friends than service providers! 

All in all a spectacular resort at which we couldn't find a fault. We will be coming back for sure, and started looking forward to our next stay before we had even finished this one. Thanks for an amazing Christmas Luna2. 

Shaun & Laura, Sydney 

PS. thanks for the surprise Xmas presents in our room when we returned for bed on Xmas evening, a great treat, much unexpected and truly appreciated!
title: Stop reading reviews and book!

text:
I was lucky enough to spend three weeks at Luna2 Studiotel and I can safely say that everyday was a brilliant experience. Wether it be the gorgeous staff or the super cool interiors, my stay at Luna2 was simply brilliant. 

Many of the hotels in Bali are much the same and being able to find somewhere so exciting and different was a total treat. Its not often that you can say that a hotel excites you, but this is exactly what Luna2 Studiotel does. The staff are all so polite and helpful and when you combine this with simply delicious food it makes for a brilliant experience. 

I can't write and not mention the rooms. Luna2 Studiotel really does blow your mind away when it comes to an alternative hotel set up. The rooms are all furnished to perfection with amazingly comfy beds, all the gadgets that you could want and a huge bathroom. Yet the hotel manages to achieve all of this with incredible sophistication and exciting design. Just look at the website and you will see what I mean. 

Yet if your not someone who likes to stay in, why, there are a multitude of beach bars a short walk away. The hotel has two incredible bars (Pop and Space), both of which make the evenings a lot of fun. The cocktail list was particularly impressive. Or, if you didn't feel like a drink the 16 seater private cinema was a great way to spend any evening and with a film collection like theirs I nearly went every night!

If your in Bali and bored of the same old set ups go and see this place, it will take your breath away. 

Lastly I cannot thank the hotel enough for giving me such a memorable and happy stay.
title: Private Paradise

text: Writing this review as i await my flight back home after checking out from an amazing 2 nights at Luna2 Studiotel for my wedding anniversary. I booked this hotel via telephone only 8 hours before my flight to Bali, greeted by a very friendly staff and my reservation was immediately confirmed. We arrived at the hotel at 10pm and were greeted by the front office staff(who was super friendly to us thru out our stay but i did not get his name unfortunately) by my name! We were brought to our room 2 minutes later and when we entered the room, my wife and I went WOW! We both commented that this will be the best hotel we will ever stayed at and we were right. The room (and the entire hotel in general) has a retro and hippy feel to it. The room has 3 televisions, a (at least) 5 metres sofa, kitchen area with complete cooking stove and eating utensils, bathtub, separate (rain) shower and toilet area, his and hers vanity sink, king size bed, an ipod with a kickass playlist to go with the mood of hotel theme, balcony overlooking a super cool looking swimming pool !!! I can go on and on with the room amenities actually. The breakfast has a unique concept unlike the ones you usually will see in hotels/resorts. The hotel has only about 14 rooms and we were one of only few ones there so all the staffs are more than willing to talk with you and help you out no matter what the request is. The hotel is about 5 to 10 minutes by taxi to Seminyak Square and about 30 minutes to the airport. Seminyak beach is 30 seconds walk from the hotel and Ku De Ta is 5 minutes walk along the beach! After checking out, we decided to go out to Seminyak Square for 1 last shopping trip and foot massage. We came back 2 hours later to watch a movie at the hotel's movie theatre. YES! You read it right. The hotel has a 16 seater movie theatre with huge comfortable reclining seats! We refreshed ourselves after the movie and the staff gladly booked a taxi for us to the airport. The entire team consisting the manager, security, front office staff, porter all waved us goodbye when we boarded taxi. In the taxi, my wife and I said - finally, we have found a hotel that we WILL come back to whenever we come to Bali.
title: Hidden Gem in Bali

text:
We spent hours looking through reviews on Tripadvisor, and if you're doing the same - stop, and book your accommodation with Luna2 and the team - you won't regret it! 

As soon as you walk through the door you are blown away by the uniqueness of the decor. Think monopoly boards, primary colours, retro 50s and modern art.  If you're after something a little bit special in a hotel - this is the place for you.

When we arrived we were welcomed with complimentary champagne, chocolate, a cool face towel and friendly staff with exceptional English - perfect after a 1.5 hour drive from Padang Bai without air-con. 

We also met fellow Australians Jessica (Front Officer Manager) and Brendan (Executive Chef) who were amazing!  

Jess helped arrange everything throughout our stay - a Scooter, day trips, Tour to Ubud, restaurant referrals and bookings - the list goes on!  Nothing was ever a hassle and it gave us piece of mind having a local help guide us through our first trip to Bali.

Brendan's food is fantastic, make sure you order dinner at least once while you stay!  Brendan also gave us the insiders knowledge about Bali's best restaurants, the locals and where the best chefs source their ingredients from - we spent 2 weeks in Bali and didn't get sick, he knows his food!

The attention to detail in the hotel was exceptional, the room we stayed in (the standard Studio room) was perfect - the bed was super comfy, the pillows were amazing, the shower was huge and I swear the whole place was cleaned at least 3 times a day!

The photos of the rooms on the website really don't do them justice.  They are huge, each have a colour theme and come equipped with an iPad, iPod & dock, 3 TVs, HUGE bathroom and so much more.  

The pool area is great with comfortable lounges and service buttons so that you don't even have to get up for a cocktail.  The immaculately dressed waitresses are happy to bring out anything you wish (they are kitted out in knee high boots and 50s style matching hats and dresses - lovely touch). 

Downstairs there is a 16 seat private cinema which plays 3 times per day - you can order popcorn and drinks and the chairs are amazing!  There is also a nightclub-like lounge bar next to the cinema if you'd rather a few drinks (or the rooftop bar for sunsets!) 

All in all we ABSOLUTELY LOVED this hotel. By far the best that either of us had experienced before in terms of amenities, attention to detail and service. We have already booked our next flights back! 

100% recommend staying at Luna 2 - you won't be disappointed! 

Darren & Ashlee
title: Stop Looking & Book @ Luna2 !!

text:
I was goggling on TripAdvisor for an unusual hotel in Seminyak as we were going from Ubud after a brief stay at  Uma @ COMO. We wanted a change from a Balinese style resort and was won over to. Luna 2 Studiotel based on the wonderful reviews we read on. TripAdvisor. 
After a rather anxious search for the hotel by our driver from Ubud, we were pleasantly surprised by the refreshing champagne and chocolate and the warm greetings of the staff at Luna 2 including Jessica & Exec Chef Brendan, upon our arrival.
Our room, Bond on 3, was amazing and way beyond our expectations. Everything in the room was colourful, well designed and funky, coloured co-ordinated in green and functional. We posted various images of the room on our Facebook and our friends were 'green with envy'
Breakfast was excellent and we loved the different combo fresh juices on offer. Executive Chef Brendan was ever so attentive and always that we were happy with the menu. He even discussed our dinner menu with us to ensure that it met with our dietary needs and preferences. The dinner was excellent and delicious and we decided to dine at Luna2 again on our last night rather than our earlier preference for another fine dining restaurant nearby. 
Location wise, it was just a short walk to Seminyak beach. The walk along the beach at Sunset was lovely and the stretch to Double 6 beach was so vibrant at night. Initially we did have some problems finding our bearings but eventually we realised that the hotel is just about 10 mins away from the shopping street of Jln Raya Seminyak and the many restaurants and bars nearby.
The staff at Luna2 were extremely friendly, polite, helpful and attentive. The masseur that I had for an in room massage was rather good. Daily one or more of the senior staff would inquire about our stay and our needs and we truly appreciate their warm gestures.
We would highly recommend Luna2 Studiotel to all our friends. We would definitely come back to this hotel when we do visit. Bali again.
title: Personalised service at a gem of a hotel

text:
We rarely felt inspired to post on Tripadvisor but our stay in Luna2 over the weekend has motivated us to help spread the good word on the hotel, and maybe kickstart our writing career with Tripadvisor.  

We've stayed in a ton of hotels over the years and we were hoping for an "in between" hotel this time in Bali.  We want the comfort of a five-star hotel but the quaint factor of a boutique.  After some scouring and researching, we landed ourselves a booking with Luna2 for a Studio room.  Like a 5-star hotel, they acceded to helping us make reservations at various restaurants, arranging for airport pick up, and preparing a birthday cake to be sent to our room.  

We'd recommend booking the airport transfer although you do end up paying up more than the usual taxi ride.  We landed at midnight and was glad to sift out our driver easily amidst the sea of name boards/placards at the arrival hall with his illuminated board.  We were ushered to a mini van, and were served a bottle of appropriately chilled white wine as the driver quietly drives on.  Disclaimer; I suspect the complimentary wine might have been a special service as one of us was celebrating a birthday but you can order a soda or a glass of wine the moment you board the mini van (driver would hand out a drinks menu).  

We arrived at the hotel past midnight and were greeted by two members of staff with the professionalism you'd expect from a good hotel.  Checking in was a breeze and took no more than ten minutes.  The room was exactly as the hotel website depicts; large, comfortable, and colourful.  The hotel even took the liberty to leave us a bottle of warm chocolate milk and cookies for a late night snack.  Bathroom was large, but there was no door to it and only a glass to separate the room from it, so you'd expect couples to be more comfortable in this setting.  You can find the basic amenities in the bathroom, and if they aren't provided free of charge, you can simply take them from a well-stocked shelf in the bathroom and pay prices you would at a convenient store.  It's a breath of fresh air since we are used to hotels charging us exorbitant prices for the smallest things.  If there is anything the hotel could improve on in its inventory is to provide some bedroom slippers.  

We would also recommend arranging for full body massage.  While there isn't the fanfare of a high end spa with elaborate forms for patrons to fill out and jars of scents to choose from, we did get very good massages with a view to kill.  On one of the two massages we arranged for, we had it in the private villa (next door to the studiotel) overlooking the sea.  They even had one of the rooms in the villa prepared (air con and music turned on) for us to change out of our clothes in.  On the second occasion, they had massage tables prepared in 15 minutes after our call in the rooftop bar of the hotel, also overlooking the sea.  Look for Widya for a very good massage.  

The location of the hotel is another plus point.  It is essentially a five minute walk on the beach to Ku de ta, and maybe ten minute to Potato Head Beach club although we took a taxi for the latter.  The path on the beach at night is not very well lit, but it's safe and comfortable to walk on.  Everywhere that mattered is just a taxi ride away, and fares are usually very cheap (about IDR 30,000 to most places).  We saw some small cars parked outside of the hotel and would assume those are for rental if you're adventurous enough to explore tight driveways in Balinese fashion.  

Breakfast is a semi-buffet affair which we preferred served to the room.  You can choose to have it in the restaurant as well.  We also had the "in-flight dining" during one of the dinners, which is basically dinner served compact on a tray to your room as you would on board a flight.  In all fairness, we felt this was something you could do away.  We read in some reviews of good fettuccine alfredo but unfortunately the "in-flight" menu did not include it.  Really, we had the choice of chicken or beef (like you would on board a flight), and while they taste good, they are somewhat forgettable.  We recommend, however, going for a movie and a meal (hotdog sandwich+beer/bubbly) in the private cinema in the basement.  They have three time slots for their showing and movies are very current.  If you are from Singapore, the seats and services in this 16-seater cinema are basically like GV Gold Class, fully recline-able seats with call buttons for service.  

Some nit-picking; We were hoping there'd be some parties at the roof top on Saturday night but it was unfortunately closed.  There were some mosquitoes while we were hanging out in the balcony at night, but nothing too uncontrollable.  

If privacy is something you hold dear to, this hotel is a superb choice.  While we see a few couples during breakfast or heading back to their rooms, we had just the right amount of privacy otherwise.

Nicholas and Jingle
title: Good stay in Luna2

owner_response.text:
Dear Velvetsage,

Greetings from Luna2 and thank you for your recent stay with us. I want to thank you personally for your detailed review. Guests’ perspective is of the utmost importance to us, and your constructive feedback is extremely valuable for our team.

We are very pleased to hear that Luna2 studiotel exceeded your expectations, as we do provide 5* services but with exclusivity and privacy not found at resorts. Our team will be very happy to know that the special birthday surprises and small gestures like hot cocoa and cookies as a late-night snack on arrival did not go unnoticed. We are thrilled that you celebrated your birthday with us, and we hope we made it a memorable one. 

Thank you for your comments regarding our airport pickup. It is a service that many of our guests rave about, due to the convenience over taxis and the amenities our drivers serve enroute to Luna2. I must let you know that the wine is complimentary as part of the service, but I am pleased that it added to your birthday celebrations. 

I will definitely pass on your comments regarding the massages to our spa team. As you mentioned, we do not have a full spa like other resorts, but we do have very talented massage therapists on-site who are able to provide massages and reflexology treatments in-room, poolside, or even on the rooftop or next door on the ocean-view terrace at Luna2 private hotel (if available). I will share your compliments with Widya.  

Our in-house movie theatre, Lunaplex, continues to be a favourite attraction for our guests, and I am very pleased you were able to enjoy our selection of new releases and our famous hot dogs! Regarding your other meal, I will share your comments regarding the ‘in-flight’ dining to our chefs.  We pride ourselves on providing this in-room dining experience that is above and beyond normal room service dining. We appreciate your feedback, and will strongly consider including more menu options along with other enhancements so that this experience is on par with our food & beverage offerings in our other venues. 

Many of our guests, like you, also enjoy the premium selection of amenities in the essentials bar in every room. We are happy to provide these items for them, and we know how convenient they can be when you arrive late at night. Regarding your comment on providing slippers, we are actually discussing our in-room amenities and your recommendation is very appreciated. In addition, we were happy you were able spend some time on your private balcony, but it is unfortunate that the mosquitoes made it less enjoyable. We do provide mosquito spray in the essentials bar that you can have for your entire trip, or our staff can provide some for you for the evening. We do our best to minimise mosquitoes through regular fogging, as they are a common nuisance in Bali.  

We continually aim to meet high standards for the personalised, attentive service that you experienced.  Additionally, I am also glad that you were able to walk down the beach to KU DE TA and Potatohead. We are fortunate to have such a location, close to some of Seminyak’s best bars and restaurants, with the resorts providing enough light for a nice night-time walk on the beach. The fleet of cars, or Lunamobiles as we call them, that you noticed in the parking lot are available upon request, with our drivers able to provide drop-offs within Seminyak or reserved for daytrips. 

Thank you once again for sharing your feedback with us and everyone on TripAdvisor.  My team and I continue to work hard to please every Luna2 guest. We would love to welcome you to Luna2 again, (possibly for another birthday next year!) so please feel free to contact me personally at +62 361 730 402 for any queries as I am happy to assist.

Thank you again, and we look forward to continue attracting more guests to Luna2 and the Island of Gods.

With kind regards,

Jessica Lee Cook | Front Office Manager | Luna2

text:
We spent a couple of days at this hotel last month for my birthday and we were blown away!! From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we had the most awesome experience. 
The hotel, is stylish, funky and the rooms are large, clean, modern and extremely comfortable. The attention to detail was extraordinary and they seemed to think of absolutely everything. 
We were met the GM on arrival who introduced us to his very efficient and friendly team, we were offered champagne and chocolates which was a nice change from a scented towel and horrible fruit juice!  
From then on the whole experience was a smooth ride and something we didn't want to end.
The location is amazing and great being so close to the beach, 5 mins walk to Kudata.
The breakfast was absolutely delicious and the lovely head chef would pop over every morning for a quick chat and to see how we were.
The only thing I would say is the cocktails by the pool were a little expensive and could have had a bit more originality to them to go with the funky hotel theme. 
We had booked into the W hotel after this one but to be honest I wish we'd just stayed here for the whole trip as after the standard this hotel set it was very hard to beat.
We've told everyone we know about this amazing gem of a hotel as its definitely up there with one of our most favorite hotels we've ever stayed in.
The only negative thing I can  say is how long we're going to have to wait to come back!!!
title: This hotel will blow you away!

text:
I seldom review the hotels that I stayed in unless I was wow-ed by them and Luna2 Studiotel is definitely worth writing for. 

We stayed at Luna2 Studiotel for 3 nights (16-19 September 2014). This is our 2nd time in Bali and we didn't want to stay in a Balinese-style villa, which we did the last time. I chanced upon Luna2 Studiotel on mrandmrssmith website and was attracted to it immediately! Prior to arrival at the hotel, I contacted the hotel via email for some enquiries and requests, and replies were informative and swift. Thanks Carina!

On checking in, which was quick and hassle-free, we were served champagnes, chocolates and cold towels, and personally greeted by the GM Jonah who was friendly and even recommended us some restaurants to try in Seminyak. He was chatty, personable and made us feel welcomed.

The room was spacious, clean and comfortable.

The hotel design was vibrant and fun, full of colourful pop-art. We particularly liked the cute Monopoly-inspired decorations littered throughout the hotel. The hotel looks exactly as the photos we've seen online: colourful, fun and unique, so much so that I do not have to post any photos below for reference! The pool was awesome and we had a great splashing time there swimming or just lying around on the cute floats. We were lucky and had the whole pool to ourselves when we were there. In fact, as there are only 14 rooms in the hotel, during our entire stay there, we only bumped into 1-2 other customers and the whole place felt very private, which was what we wanted on our vacations. The other interesting feature of the hotel is a 16-seat cinema which was comfortable and had 3 screenings/day.

The staff at Luna2 Studiotel were polite, friendly, helpful, attentive and knowledgeable. Their smiles really lit up our days. They helped us a lot in making and confirming our restaurant and spa reservations, as well as arranging transport for us. Most importantly, they respected our privacy and were not intrusive. Kudos to them! Service was impeccable. In the evenings, they prepared water for us in the room, as well as light jazzy music, which was a pleasant surprise when we returned to our room after a day out.

The location of the hotel was ideal. It was just a very short walk to and from Seminyak Beach. We walked all the way from Potato Head Beach Club back to the hotel via Seminyak Beach at sunset and it was lovely. The hotel is tucked away in a quiet corner, away from the hustle and bustle of Seminyak, yet it takes only 5-10 minutes by taxi to the many restaurants and bars in Seminyak.

We were supposed to have an 'in-flight' dinner from our booking but we declined as we wanted to try out some of the famous/popular restaurants in Bali. However the chef prepared a delicious take-away breakfast for us on check-out as our flight to Yogyakarta (our next holiday destination) was very early in the morning.

All in all, we had a great time and will definitely recommend Luna2 Studiotel to all our friends and family who are visiting Bali. In fact, many of them were excited looking at our photos!

If only we had to nit-pick, maybe there are a few small things that Luna2 Studiotel could improve on:
1) May want to consider providing basic amenities such as toothbrush and toothpaste instead of selling them. Also, may want to consider providing complimentary snacks/drinks on top of the usual bottled water, coffee and tea.
2) We find the airport transfer (both the VIP and the regular transfer) really too expensive. May want to consider providing complimentary airport transfer, or work this into the price of the hotel booking.
3) We find certain parts of the pool to be quite deep and it'll be good if staff can look out into the pool on and off to ensure the safety of people using the pool.
4) May want to consider screening more light-hearted 'holiday-friendly' movies in the cinema. We watched a heavy weird thriller movie and fell asleep (the sofas were super comfy) and then left before the movie ended.
5) There were mosquitoes in the room (as with most places in Bali) and we requested for electrical mosquito repellants but they weren't available, so the staff helped us to Baygon-spray the room and left it with us for us to use later. May be good to provide electrical mosquito repellants as the sprays were smelly and suffocating! Luckily we usually spray and then left for dinner, so by the time we come back, the smell is gone.
6) Some small detail: When we were there, the handle of the shower 'electrocuted' us MILDLY a few times when we touched it when showering. We fedback to the hotel and hopefully this has been sorted out.

I do not want these few small things to take away from the great time that we had staying at Luna2 Studiotel. We came back to Singapore refreshed and recharged from the great time in Bali and Yogyakarta and Luna2 Studiotel contributed greatly to our wonderful experience!
title: Something unique in Bali

owner_response.text:
Dear Boon81

Greetings from Seminyak, Bali and thank you for your recent stay with us. I want to thank you personally for your extensive review, since our guests' perspective is of the utmost importance to us. Your constructive feedback is valuable for our team as well as for readers and visitors from all around the world.

We are very pleased to hear that you were “wow-ed” by Luna2 studiotel. I am glad that you enjoyed the design, as it is just one of the many features that distinguishes us from other hotels and Balinese-style villas. I am particularly pleased that you found the service to be “impeccable,” and I will be sure to share that with our team. They will be pleased to know that small gestures such as reservations, transport, packing breakfast, and music for nightly turndown did not go unnoticed. We continually aim to meet high standards for the personalised, attentive service that you experienced.  Additionally, I am also glad that you were able to walk down the beach to Potatohead. We are fortunate to be so close to some of Seminyak’s best bars and restaurants. 

I also want to thank you for providing constructive feedback, and we will be sure to address all points with serious consideration.

We do provide an in-room essentials bar, with any necessary amenities our guests may need. While these are premium products and are available for purchase, we do have standard items like toothpaste and toothbrushes available complimentary for all guests. All they have to do is ask, and our housekeeping team will deliver to their studio. The items in the essentials are exceptionally well priced, I would also point out the at the essentials items are charged at the same price as the local convenience stores which is simply unheard of in hotels. 

Our VIP airport transfer service is often a favourite experience to many of our guests. It typically includes a meet-and-greet and fast-track through airport immigration. The fast-track service is currently suspended by the Bali airport authorities through the high season, but we continue to provide cold towels and refreshments as a welcoming experience to Bali. We will discuss ways to incorporate the service into packages and rates. 

We are glad you were able to enjoy Lunaplex, our on-site private cinema. We try to keep up with the latest releases with a different movie every night, but we do have a library full of classics and comedies. Guests can occasionally request to change the movie, if no one else is using the cinema at that time. We also understand that after a day of sun or swimming in the pool, it is easy to fall asleep in the plush recliners. 

Thank you for your feedback regarding the depth of the pool.  As you experienced, it is a very large, 25m lap pool, and with only 14 rooms, guests often enjoy having the entire pool to themselves.  There is a shallow end, and there is an on-site kids coordinator to watch children in the pool, but I will discuss with the staff to be more attentive of all guests using the pool. 

Additionally it is with regret to learn that you had issues with mosquito's. While mosquito's are a common issue in Bali, we go to great lengths to minimise them for the comfort of our guests. Our exterminator fogging externally twice monthly and all doors to guestrooms are sealed when closed. This is a rare case, I will discuss the issue with our housekeeping and maintenance teams on how to remedy this in the future.

The issue regarding your shower was addressed immediately after you checked out, and it has been fixed.  Thank you for bringing it to our attention, as the safety of our guests is always of top priority. 

Thank you once again for sharing your feedback with us and everyone on TripAdvisor.  My team and I continue to work hard to please every Luna2 guest. We would love to welcome you to Luna2 again, so please feel free to contact me personally at +62 361 730 402 for any queries as I am happy to assist.

Thank you for your attention and we look forward to continue attracting more guests to Luna2 and the Island of Gods.


With Kind Regards 
Jonah Roberman | General Manager | Luna2

text: This hotel is a hidden gem.  I wish I could keep it as a secret, but I have just been raving about it since I came back. They arranged manicures and massages by the pool (the coolest pool you’ll find in Bali!), and catered to anything we needed.  We were just blown away from the moment we stepped inside. text:
Luna2 studio hotel is a located in the middle of Seminyak (hotspot) with easy access to the beach. You can walk up the beach to Ku De Ta and Potato Head within a couple of minutes.
I never saw such a well-designed hotel before. They do offer very huge suits, designed in various ways (retro, chic, avant-garde, space-age,  pop art). In short, this seems to be unique in Bali. The
service was also amazing, very friendly and attentive.
Luna2 offers a great restaurant (Orbit) as well as a rooftop bar. You'll also find huge pool in Mondrian-style (awesome!) with day-beds for all-day chill-out. Additionally, the hotel has its own cinema with very comfortable lounge seats.
Although the price is not cheap you really get a lot for your money - Luna2 is worth it!

text: What a gem of a hotel. Several times cheaper than any of the other beach hotels in Seminyak, with huge rooms, fantastic and helpful staff, beautiful large pool and great food. Our studio was really big, with incredibly quiet and efficient central air-conditioning system, lovely bathroom and beautiful views over the ocean and sunset. The balconies were enormous as well! We loved the breakfast and the staff was the most helpful we encountered anywhere in Bali. The only thing we did not like is that we only found this hotel at the very end of our 2-month stay in Bali: otherwise we would have probably spent our entire time here ;).
title: Fantastic hotel in Seminyak!

text:
Luna2 is a great little boutique hotel with quirky 1970s retro decor.  The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The staff were exceptional - After the second day, they knew who we were on a name basis - possibly because there are only 14 rooms.  Even so, you still feel very welcomed and the staff provided interesting insights to Seminyak, without being too in your face.
The only thing stopping the 5 star rating was the location.  While it is very close to the beach, it is still a bit of a walk or taxi ride to the main shopping area and restaurants / bars in Seminyak (Seminyak Square).  There didn't seem to be a lot of taxis near the hotel either.
Tip - if you order a taxi to pick you up from the hotel, they charge a minimum 30 000 Rp fare regardless of how far you travel.  Taxis off the street charged between 10 000 and 15 000 to hotel from Seminyak Square
title: Great Hotel & Staff - Location Iffy

text: Semyniak can appears like quite busy area. If you are looking for holiday in centre of fun, in touch with many restaurants, bars, spas, shops etc., but would like to sleep and stay in quiet hotel, Luna2 is best place! We spent one month in hotel Luna2 and I can it highly recomment! Really family atmosphere, the most helpful “crew” I’ve ever seen. :-) The Hotel has only 14 rooms, to be alone in swimming pool area happend  to us very often. Sometimes felt like private area only for us. They save plastic trash with complimetary jug water. You can order massage in room or in front of swimming pool. I recomment it for sure, they have great, professional therapists. Wonderful sunset view from roof top bar which is also not busy, but very romantic area. Last but not least: lovely breakfast, choice from menu, individual wishes are grant, amazing fresh juices, smoothie bowls etc. We had breakfast included. They have also restaurant for lunch or dinner with huge choice of wine. Only a little complaint about the prices in the restaurant. Meals prices are higher than nearby restaurants (including hotel restaurants). But everything else was perfect!!! Enjoy your holiday in Luna2!
title: Great place for stay in Semyniak - same same but different

text: This hotel is one of a kind. Space-age accomodation, trendy, quirky but brilliant in its own way. The rooms are beautiful and cannot be faulted. Staff are superb, breakfasts are excellent (a-la-carte plus a selection of fruits, pastries and cereals) and the pool is terrific. One good thing about this place is that there are only about 14 rooms so that you should never have to wait for a breakfast table and loungers at poolside will always be available. A walk to the main "pub street" in this part of Seminyak (lots of Aussies like me around) is 10 minutes and the narrow street is well lit at night. Highly recommended if you like a modern setting. PS; their roof top bar is very good.
title: Quirky and Special Hotel in Seminyak

text:
Tucked away in a quiet lane way just steps from the beach you will find this small intimate hotel with a unique design themed on a retro monopoly board. We weren’t sure whether we would relate well to this theme but we very quickly fell in love with this fun concept. It is so tastefully presented and kept in immaculate condition. Bali’s tropical weather often results in rapid deterioration of even the most beautiful properties but with Luna2 the maintenance and cleanliness is outstanding. It truly is a hidden gem.
Undoubtedly this is a five star rated hotel and has all the facilities you would expect. Plus more! We have stayed at exceptional hotel chains around the world including Four Seasons, Oberoi, Ritz Carltons - at none of them have we received a warmer, more personalised welcome. And the movie theatre was such a magnificent touch - a personalised screening of a recently released movie in the most amazingly comfortable surroundings. It was a lot of fun!
Our room is spacious and very well equipped. Ocean views from the balcony as well as a direct outlook onto the pool.
The rooftop bar was a fabulous place to experience the sunset over the ocean.
We are lucky that we still have another couple of days before our holiday ends as it will be hard to return to the real world. We are already dreaming of returning with family and friends and maybe one day booking the whole hotel ( there are only 14 rooms). It would be the perfect place for a special birthday or small wedding.
title: Hidden Gem

text: Just returned from 7 nights at Luna 2, we went on a luxury escape, which was great value. The staff are number 1 in being friendly and helpful, this is a small boutique hotel, only 14 rooms so it's very quiet and sometime we felt like we were the only ones staying there. (Although we weren't) food was great, the driver is a great touch, you can get dropped off any where in the local area, which is great as the hotel is down the end of a long lane and taxi can take a while. The movie theatre was also great, the staff even put a movie on request, if we didn't like the movies they were showing. We used the pool a couple of time, but it could get very hot out there as boxed in. We extended our room on the last day and the rate they charged us was very good, was lovely to not have to check out and wonder around for hours as we didn't leave for the airport till 7pm. Overall great stay. Thanks again to the great staff.
title: Relaxing and fun

text: My wife and I had to cancel a booking due to a family emergency. We canceled within Luna2's cancellation policy. Luna2 acknowledged this in writing and promised a refund. owner_response.text:
Dear HvossinHK

text:
Rooms: huge, really interestingly designed, lots of natural light, a lovely balcony where (at least on high floors) you can see the ocean, a big bath tub, and an ipod pre-loaded with a chilled retro-inspired soundtrack (such a great idea - now when I hear those songs I'm reminded of this hotel). My room wasn't perfectly maintained unfortunately - in my experience this is a frequent problem in design hotels (non-standard materials are non-standard because they're harder to maintain)
Service: fantastic, as is generally the case in Bali. I particularly loved the flexibility of the managers - I was travelling alone on a package meant for two people, they made lots of accommodations to allow me to enjoy all the inclusions
Public areas: lovely pool that I had to myself most of the time, awesome private cinema that unfortunately only showed something I wanted to see once during my 5 day stay (there's only one screening of non-kids movies each day, the movie is set by the staff - it'd be so much better if they let the first guest to inquire each day choose from a list of movies), beautifully designed lobby and restaurant, rooftop bar with fantastic sunset view over the ocean 
Food and drink: breakfast was wonderful (with my package, I got an a la carte dish from the extensive menu + fresh juice + tea or coffee + as much as I wanted from the small buffet!), lunch and dinner options were just okay, cocktails were tasty but weak
Location: On the pro side, the beach is only a few meters away. On the con side, this place is at the end of a long winding lane so it's difficult to walk into town even though it's not far as the crow flies, you can take a short-cut along the beach but you'll have to cross a creek which will result in your shoes getting saturated. But this isn't too big a problem, the hotel offers free drop off in town ("if available", it was always available without much delay when I wanted it) and after dinner good restaurants will find you a reliable bluebird taxi which will only cost $2 (if you try to hail a cab yourself, you'll probably end up with a driver that refuses to go anywhere for less than $5)
Value: My 5-bubble review is based on the fantastic deal I got (200AUD/nt with inclusions valued at about 50AUD/nt, via Luxury Escapes), if I'd paid the generally available price (~225AUD/nt in shoulder season) I'd rate it 4 bubbles
title: fun concept, lovely staff

text:
Very interesting hotel, unique style with lots of nice touches. We stayed here for 11 nights end August. It’s about 5 minutes walk to the beach, and 10 minute walks to the main shopping and restaurant streets of Seminyak. The hotel is small with 14 rooms, a pool area, bar, restaurant and private cinema. There’s a roof top bar but it shuts at 8.

The rooms are studios with large lounge/sleeping area, very comfy bed and a small kitchenette area and large shower/tub, as well as a large balcony. All decorated in 60’s retro style. We had a good breakfast included, with a la carte dishes as well as small buffet. Very good food and personal service. Pool area is a bit grey (walls are grey!) and doesn’t hit the sun all day, but the pool area was very quiet and they had buzzer service for drinks etc so nice to chill out there.

Had lunch a few times and all food was good quality, staff very friendly and the cinema is a nice touch. 

Seminyak is a nice area, but the beach isn’t great. What you get is a nice vibe, lots of good restaurants (local and lots of Aussie style places). Bits of the area are a bit shabby in Seminyak and the beach isn’t great for swimming at all. We took a car to Sunday’s Beach Club several days (1 hour) with white sand a crystal waters!) 

We enjoyed our stay at Luna 2, and there has obviously been a lot of thought put into everything here, and the team are very kind. More fun than staying in a branded hotel but still good standard (AC, Wi-Fi both top quality).
title: 11 nights in Bali!

text:
I doubt  'Jerry 123456789' from the UK was reviewing the right hotel, as nothing he mentioned connected with this hotel, this place is wonderful in all ways and we couldn't be happier with our choice.

This boutique hotel is in a central location with friendly and attentive staff. A big shout out to Agus our driver who gave us fabulous service and really made our stay special.  In fact, all the staff are great!

The studio room was quiet, large, bright, modern and clean. It had a  large bathroom and shower, a good sized and comfortable balcony which we did use (as there was no sign of the mozis)

The pool was wonderful and relaxing and all poolside furniture was free to use.  The cinema was great with comfy seats and they provided blankets in case the airconditioning was to cold. They played 2 free movies a day which our son loved at night. 
The restaurant food was good, we loved the breakfasts!

The beach was close, down a small alley, turn left and pull up a beanbag at one of the many restaurants along the beach to catch the sunset. Turn right and walk into town (approx. 15 minutes) or visit the Ku de ta Beachclub which is only a  5 minute walk.

After we left this hotel, we spent the 2nd half of our holiday in a well known large hotel in another town in Bali, it was a big let-down and we compared everything with Luna2 and wished we stayed there longer.

We recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in a modern estabilishment and would like a quieter, more personal experience.
title: We loved our stay at Luna2

text:
My friend and I stayed at the Luna2 for two nights during our trip to Bali and this hotel was awesome! It was very unique in the sense that it was like we were on a different planet... the interior decor is very pop-mod but also retro at the same time, lots of bright colours and graphic elements. 
The staff is very friendly and will cater to your every need, my friend and I were craving some pizzas one night and they were very quick to get us our yummy pizzas :) The breakfast buffet bar has various options from fruits to muffins to pastries which are really delicious. I did try their ala carte menu and ordered the croque monsieur which was amazing! The flavours balanced really well between the salty and savoury of the cheese and bechamel sauce and the sweet of the tomato relish... probably one of the best croque monsieur's that I've ever had! 
The room is great, very spacious with a private kitchen and balcony and not to mention, a retro style TV which adds a very unique touch to the room. 
The hotel has a massive shared pool, pool bar, rooftop, indoor movie theatre, laundry service and concierge services! 
I would highly recommend Luna2 as a home-away-from-home stay in the heart of Seminyak :)
title: Unique Retro Hotel with Great Facilities ....

text:
I can't say enough about how much I enjoyed this hotel. Everything from check in to check out was fantastic. 

I had originally booked another venue in Seminyak but was disappointed in the accommodations and ended up leaving. Needing to find a place at last minute I stumbled across Luna 2. From the moment of check in the staff greeted us with a smile and took our bags. The room was very large with a separate shower and tub which I love. The design was a retro modern look and the room came with a balcony that overlooked the large swimming pool. The room had everything you would want in it and the air conditioning worked great. Only thing I wish they had were blackout shades as the sun comes up early and bright. 

The beach is just a few steps away from the property and to your left is a place on the beach where chairs and umbrella can be rented for a very reasonable price. It's a clean nice part of the beach. 

Breakfast is very good as well and provided with the room. 

The pool has several areas for shade and has shallow parts and deep parts. In the morning one could easily do lap swimming while the afternoon is a prime time to chill and relax. No one else was even out there. They do have service to the pool. There's even a cool floatie. There's even a way to view the wine cellar from the pool under water. 

You can't stay there without catching a sunset at the rooftop bar. Great cocktails and wonderful view. 

I didn't check out the cinema but it's really neat that they have one provided and daily showings with a children's movie followed by a movie for grown ups. 

This area is quiet but it's about a 10-minute walk to busy part of town where there are plenty of restaurants and shops along with bars. 

Best of all you get five-star accommodations at a reasonable price. This is one of the best places I have ever stayed at and will truly be remembered for years to come. Anyone going to Bali and staying in Seminyak I would highly recommend to stay at this place.
title: Amazing stay for a reasonable price

text:
For the past weeks I went to Bali with my friends (total 4 of us)and stayed in Luna2 Studiotel. This hotel isn't famous in most of the hotel booking website mostly because it is not a big hotel group like Hard Rork, Marriott...etc. The reason we get to know this Luna2 is thru an agency name Bleeps.

The most memorable about this hotel is the service they provided. I would not say is perfect however they did their level best and compare to others they have more value added services. Our booking includes airport transfer by a 7-8 seaters LunaMobile (I think this is the only vehicle they have for the guests). Luna2 does not have a big signboard or logo at the entrance, it looks a bit secretive.

When we stepped into the lobby, the porter helps to carry our luggages and we are welcomed nicely by the staff. I like the smile of most of the staffs there. After all the check-in procedures we were lead to our rooms and they explained to us the facilities inside the room, then a welcome cocktail drinks with a chocolate is served.

The room is amazing! You can get more photos in their website and you get exactly what you see.  Each of the rooms has slight different design and the whole hotel is decorated like the board game - Monopoly.

As for free shuttle, as long as your destination is within the Seminyak area they will do the free transfer for you, otherwise you can ask them book a Blue Bird Taxi or Grab Car for you. Everytime when we saw the workers there especially the front counter staff, they will ask what is your program today? (not sure if they want to offer any tours for you or what) but they never be pushy. 

One the same day night we check-in, when we back to hotel and my friends came to our room for drinking, we smell something weird in our room. That time is near to 12am. We searched every corner in the room but did not found any suspicious things, so we called to front counter and send someone to check on it. Their respond is very fast. within 10 mins they came and also smell something is weird. After 10mins searching the room they apologize that they unable to find the source of weird smell, so they offer us to move to another room. They give us 15mins to pack our stuffs then helped us to move to 1st floor, which next to my friend's room.

This room (Green, 1st floor) is abit dated compared to the the first room (Yellow, 3rd floor). However we appreciated so much their prompt action. On the next day when we  saw the staff at the lobby, they apologize again and explained the reason of the weird smell. They are really courtesy. 

Breakfast is continental style. Do not expect too much for its breakfast because the hotel only has 12 rooms, so breakfast selection is very limited. Our breakfast is included with a cup of tea/coffee and a glass of fruit juice. On the second day breakfast, we ordered from their menu. I would say the food they cook really awesome! I love the omelette with Truffle so much, and the price is not too much also! You can sit next to the pool and enjoy your breakfast under sunlight.

To the beach is only 5 mins walking distance. To main street is about 15 mins by walking. Just some tips for those who enjoying walking - If you walk up to North you will come to Seminyak Square Area which is very happening street with lots of good restaurants and bars, there is also 4 convenient shop along Marriott Hotel. Do use Google Map when you plan to walk around :)

Do go to the roof top and sit on the bench facing the ocean, very relaxing!

There is some comments from my friend, in our room there is a coffee maker but we can't find any capsule. Also they did not provide slipper in the room. 

Overall Luna 2 is the best hotel I ever stayed for its service provided. You can really have a good rest here and maybe enjoyed sunbath beside the pool. Will definitely recommend to my friends especially couple to stay here when to plan to visit Bali (ya now I know why they call Luna 2, is for couple!!). Thank you very Luna 2 for the hospitality. Terima Kasih ~
title: Perfect for couple and Quite Seeker

text: Luna2 is groovy! I had a blast staying at thus fun, quirky hotel! From my welcome cocktail to my private screening in their movie theatre (complete with fresh, buttered popcorn!) to my tasty breakfast in bed, everything was PERFECT! I was there on a rainy day, and were not able to enjoy the pool or beach, but there was more than enough to keep me busy at this hotel! My suite had a fully loaded iPod and Bose sound dock to set the tone for a relaxing night in! I enjoyed bespoke cocktails on Luna’s rooftop with killer views of the Indian Ocean, followed by “in-flight dining” for dinner in my suite! I was served a gourmet meal on a quirky airplane tray that even came with personalized 1st class “ticket” to the moon!  It was served retro flight attendant style, and the concept was really cool! And if I had ventured outside of the hotel during our stay I noticed that Luna2 would even pack a beach bag for me full of necessities and beach toys! What’s more, every staff member went out of their way to come and chat with me on a personal level, which was a nice departure from Bali’s typically very formal service standards. I wish I could have stayed longer at Luna2! Love this place!
title: Luna2 is groovy!

text:
Luna2 is a great boutique hotel, steps away from the beach. My partner and I stayed in the Studio suite and we didn't expect the room to be as big as it was! We received a complimentary pick up from the airport, cocktails and cute little chocolate on arrival and it felt as though we had the whole hotel to ourselves!

The Studio suites are great! There is a small kitchen with stovetop, sink and SMEG fridge. The circular couch in the lounging area is amazing and I want to get my hands on one asap! The bathroom was enormous, unfortunately we weren't there long enough to enjoy the bath but the shower and included amenities were fantastic. The iPad has all the info you need if you want to go out and about, the iPod mini is choc full of music, we would just hit play each time we got back to the room and enjoy whatever was shuffling. 

The staff are amazing, Australian hotels could learn a thing or two about service from these people. They are attentive and friendly and never shy of a conversation. We also had a late check out so could enjoy a lay in. Included in the rate was breakfast which was great. Unfortunately for a vegan, there was only one or two things for me to eat but my partner loved it. I enjoyed a porridge with local, poached fruit (SO GOOD!) alongside their 'Red Dragon' juice (highly recommend.) As well as a main breakfast meal, you are also invited to the buffet where they provide small pastries, fruit, yoghurt, granola, toast etc. 

The pool is awesome, super long and the perfect temperature for cooling off. The service buzzers alongside the sun lounges are rad, just punch the buzzer and one of their friendly staff are out in a flash to take your order. 

Definitely recommend!!
title: Best staff and Amenities!

text:
This place is an absolute 'must-do' when visiting Bali. 
For me, Luna2 was more than just a hotel, it was an experience and an amazing experience at that!
Everywhere you look from the art on the walls to the dance floor that lights up like the scene from Stayin' Alive, every little detail has been thoroughly thought out. The theme runs throughout the entire hotel and I felt like a child in a candy store discovering what was around every corner!
The staff are wonderful, very friendly and super helpful and I felt like nothing was too big or to small to ask of them, if that wasn't enough they seemed to get a lot of delight out of any request, I felt like royalty - if only for the short time I was there!!
For me however, the real stand out was the food! It was on another level, the produce was fresh and the creative menu was simply inspiring and super delicious. I was lucky enough to meet the chef, Alanna who is clearly very passionate about her cuisine and it showed with yet again, every detail thought through - 'absolutely and utterly delicious'. We have come to expect good food from Bali these days but Chef Alanna takes it to a whole new level! 
I thoroughly recommend the Sunday Roast, yet another experience with the wagyu beef so tender it melts in your mouth, of course it is served with all the trimmings we want on our Sunday Roast but every single element is worthy of its own plate - and crown! Horseradish mouse, light and fluffy potatoes with a crunchy coat, cauliflower bake with a hint of blue cheese, oh my god I'm still tasting it on my tastebuds and I honestly and genuinely can not wait to go back to Bali for more!
Thanks Luna2 and all the your wonderful staff for an unforgettable experience!
title: An experience off the planet!

text:
We had an amazing time at Luna2. Our first time at Luna2 was 2 years ago and they have maintained the same standards since then. The hotel grounds are impeccably maintained and so clean. Something rare in beach resort destinations. The sand and dirt always gets tracked in somehow, but not here. It’s spotless, including the pool. No dead leaves or insects swimming in there. 

We hardly ever went out because it was so comfortable. They really thought of everything you would need for a comfortable stay. The design is unique and has so many clever touches. Example, the a/c automatically turns off when the balcony doors are open. Lunaplex - the private cinema is just so plush and luxurious. I didn’t have time to watch a movie there but it looks really amazing. The restaurant served delicious food at reasonable prices. The breakfast each morning was perfect. You have the option of one hot breakfast and they are all good. They were so accommodating of our annoying food intolerances (dairy, gluten and egg free).

A few improvements for a truly out of this world experience - 
Dimmers that work. Lighting was too bright for night time. There were dimmer switches but they don’t work. 
Black-out curtains for guests who want to sleep in. It’s actually the first place we stayed that doesn’t have black out curtains. It would be helpful especially in Bali where the sunrises at 6am. 

Most importantly everyone there was so friendly and genuine. Thanks to all staff for the wonderful experience. So sorry I cant remember everyone’s names. I will not list them here because I know I will miss someone out. But thank you all! You’ve spoiled us and it will be difficult to find a another hotel of such standards - luxurious, high quality and yet so personal and genuinely friendly. It’s a a combination of qualities very difficult to achieve.
title: Amazing service with personal rouch

text:
Through a secret side entrance you are instantly transported to your own private experience. While we sipped on a delicious 'Lunatini' welcome cocktail, Krisna at the front desk made sure we felt welcome and had all the information we needed for our stay.

The decor is amazing and you really feel like you have stepped out of Bali and back in time, but in a really glamorous way. The studio's are so well equipped you could easily stay a while, and are the perfect place to host a little party if you felt inclined. Luxe kitchen accessories including fully stocked SMEG fridge, Nespresso coffee machine and induction cooking. The kitchen supplies also include enough champagne glasses for friends to pop in for a drink.

We decided to head to the rooftop bar instead and took advantage of the happy hour cocktails with prime position on the beach for the sunset.

Taking the advice of the Chef who stopped by to have a chat we decided to go for the 'Inflight Dining' for dinner. Basically room service but not basic at all. I wont spoil the surprise but definitely not to be missed. The quality of the food and speed of delivery was second to none. Topped off with deluxe bath (also with flatscreen TV), wine, super comfy bed and on demand movies we obviously had a fantastic night!

** Additional things we loved
- Breakfast menu (included healthy options) and fast delivery
- Essentials mini bar in the bathroom included all the toiletries you might need, eye masks, razors, moisturiser, deodorant, eye drops etc.
- Listening to the ocean on the large balcony
- Ironing station and laundry service
- The big fluffy white towels and lush bed linens 
- The huge pool and poolside facilities
-The service!! We couldn't flaw any of the staff, unreal.
title: A star in the Sky - Exclusive and Surprising
