text:
Luna 2 hotel has been an amazing, cosmic, whirlwind of an experience! Stepping off the plane into Denpasar airport can be chaotic at best with offers of all mode of transport being thrown at you by those trying to make some money out of exhausted tourists after a long journey. It was with relief that I was whisked away by the VIP airport transport service provided by Luna 2, this is a BIG recommendation after a long plane ride. 

The hotel itself is very colourful and fun featuring some amazing pop art. Each room is a different colour and has all the necessities that one may need including a balcony overlooking the pool. It is in a well situated area in Seminyak with the beach a few hundred metres away and Seminyak Square being a 15 minute walk along the beach. Although it is not right in the centre I felt it to be quite nice to be able to come back to walk out of the hotel and onto a somewhat less busy part of the beach. The fact that the Studiotel only has 14 rooms make it feel a lot more personal than a normal hotel, for example all of the hotel employees knew my name on arrival which i thought was a nice touch. They also asked if I wanted my suitcase unpacked which is a service that a larger hotel may not provide. 

In my opinion it would be a great hotel for those looking the get away from the large corporate hotels that have hundreds of guests coming and going, great for couples or a family as they have many entertainment options including their own cinema. I cannot provide my opinion on the food as I did not eat at the restaurant however it looked as they had all bases required with breakfast,lunch,dinner and an all day menu suited to the western palate. 

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here, thanks to all of the staff who made it so wonderful!
title: Wow!

text: My wife and I stayed 6 nights at Luna 2. This is a 5 star design hotel, 100 metres from Seminyak beach. I love the location as I can safely store my board here and surf while my wife and I enjoy the luxurious facilities of Luna 2. We love their 25 metre pool and their underground movie theatre where we regularly watched late release movies with excellent sound quality for free, while enjoying a meal and a beer. This place rocks! We were included in a rooftop bar promotion of Verve champagne, while watching the sunset over the waves. The breakfast here is long and sumptuous with interesting choices. Luna 2's Indonesian staff speak English well, are professional and ever friendly, patient and helpful. They can provide you with a free lift to where you want to be, if there is a vehicle available. Helmut is the food and beverage magician here and he is attentive, effervescent and so helpful. Jessica is the stylish front office manager who contacted us before our arrival to assist us with dinner & massage bookings, and anything else we needed pre arrival. Jessica provides 5 star service with knowledge, grace and good humour that makes staying at Luna 2 an outstanding holiday experience. Well done team, we will be back!
title: Wow & Wow

text:
This is now one of my favourite hotels anywhere! We stayed for 5 nights with our 6year old son, who was also very sad to leave - "the bed is so nice and comfortable, I love the cinema. I will miss the 'boys' (he means the waiters)."
Luna2 is fun and sophisticated. It's a small boutique hotel with a light touch, but expertly run. The cocktail menu is outstanding - I drank so much more than I wanted to. The food was great without exception and everyone is very helpful and kind. We also liked the rooftop bar which has a great view to the beach. We love the design, but we are Star Trek fans and retro junkies. The rooms are large with ample storage and very well laid out.
The hotel has its own cinema - 3 shows a day, the one at 3:30pm is child friendly. We have been traveling in Asia for more than 20 years and live in the region which results in a limited interest in excursions. By 3 o'clock we were usually exhausted from running around with the 6 year old. Being able to sit down to an entertaining movie with popcorn (for him) and a martini (for me) was a real treat - it's like gold class, but better. 
We arrived unusually unprepared, but the staff had plenty of great suggestions - where to go, eat, what to do generally. It's unobtrusive and charming full service.
A warm thank you to Jessica and Helmut for taking care of us so well - we will come again and recommend the place to anyone who doesn't need a traditional villa with a private wading pool. I sort of feel I haven't come home from staying in a hotel, but from visiting friends with a very nice big house.
title: Delightful time capsule

text:
Arriving at Luna2 Studiotel is like no other experience we have had - we travel ALOT!

It's one thing to arrive into a seriously amazing foyer and pool area but to be greeted by the GM Brendan and front office Manager Jess who were so genuine instantly I new this was going to work for our family - my husband and 3 boys 20, 18 and 16.

Luna2 Studiotel offers incredible rooms - I doubt you will find this incredible style anywhere else and definitely not in Bali - All credit to Melanie Hall who had a vision and has managed to pull it off like you won't believe! 

The food is just delicious  - nothing is too much trouble for the ever friendly and accommodating Chef Errol and his right hand woman Allanah - be it an impromptu dinner for 9 on the rooftop terrace - yep we asked if this was possible at 5pm and by 8 pm we were sitting to down to a 5 course seriously unbelievable dinner - or a super food salad for breakfast nothing appears to be too much trouble.  

I even spent an afternoon in the private cinema with 2 x 5 year olds watching the Lego Movie - sadly I didn't quite make it to the end as I was so comfy in my seat that turned into a plush bed and then when the attendant put a soft, comfy blanket on me I was out for the count! 

Can you imagine when I woke and stumbled out the door with my little friends only to discover the private nightclub!  The girls thought they were in heaven - so did I later on that night!  

We met some amazing people lying by the pool on our oversized sun beds - one wall around the pool is completely covered in fabulous POPART!  

I know I mentioned a bit before about the wonderful staff but I cannot sign off without mentioning in person Jess and Helmet, Jess being front office Manager and Helmet heads up food and beverage, I have tried hard to find something they cannot conquer, I have thrown everything at them and in true Luna2 style they make you feel like your request is just so simple and easy. Jess knows everywhere to shop, pamper yourself etc etc in Bali and Helmet can arrange any drink under the sun! I know all this is important but it was the impromptu genuine chats that make you feel so comfortable here I am going to miss you all!!  Thank you guys you made my holiday and I am going home feeling terribly relaxed! Carrie
title: There is only 1 Luna2 Studiotel!

text:
I had a 2 day stay at Luna2 Studiotel my first time in Bali. The previous reviews on trip advisor helped me select this location. I loved the style which reminded me of Austin Powers and since this was the last leg of my vacation- I wanted something unique and private near the ocean. Everyone was friendly and helpful. My bank decided to cancel my payment because they thought it was an out of state purchase and the staff handled it beautifully and did not give up my reservation. They contacted me and since I was traveling with limited web access, they were patient and understanding. 

Upon my arrival, I was greeted by the GM Jonah and several staff who were all very welcoming, champagne, chocolate (my first sweets in weeks!), and a cold towel to freshen up. It was late and I didn't want to figure out Seminyak at 9pm so I ordered the fettuccini alfredo with black truffle oil- which was amazing melt in your mouth deliciousness-definately recommend it to everyone. Bali is not known for its Italian food so I was taking a risk ordering it but I am extremely glad I did. 

The rooms are AMAZING! If you love art, decor, design, luxury, and style- this is the place for you. The images online are spot on. You will find pop art, monopoly art, artsy and modern furniture and accessories. Luna2 studiotel is fun and unique-haven't seen anything like it anywhere else in Bali or many other places I have traveled to. I stayed in Bond on Three and my decorations were all green- including the round sofa, lights, bath decorations etc. Love it- and it looked over the pool and a temple. 

It was very private- i saw maybe one other couple during my two days. All the staff were super friendly and would hold great conversations with me while I waited for transportation. I even found out that their IT guy was an amazing photographer. I walked to the beach and to the stores solo during the time I was there and felt safe. 

My flight was at midnight and since I had checked out they were very accomodating and allowed me to freshen up before my flight. I loved that they provided wifi/ipad/ipod for music, etc. In summary-it was a great experience and I would absolutely recommend Luna2studiotel to everyone I know. 

All photos posted are spot on so I wont post mine. 

The only thing I was not comfortable with- which was out of their control- was that the temple had a ceremony one of the nights and they were chanting and playing music for a while. At first I was excited to see this cultural side but after a while it was a bit much. I just closed the balcony glass doors and the problem was solved. Just FYI.
title: Trendy Stuiotel

text:
Bali is not just an Island Paradise anymore. On the world's stage it now represents the sleekest resorts, world class restaurants and cutting edge design stores of both fashion and lifestyle.
Luna2 Studiotel will be attractive to the discerning design aficionado looking to be truly pampered in the most convenient location. The 14 room boutique hotel sits tucked just behind the Luna2 Private Villa on Seminyak Beach with direct access to the water via a short path.
The Studiotel is an oasis rarely found within the highly desirable Seminyak area. The boutique hotel and its rooms would make any Wallpaper devotee feel right at home amongst the James Bond/Andy Warhol vibe that the architecture and interior design have created out of a Monopoly board. The in house technology and hotel room comfort is outstanding leaving nothing out!  Hotel cleanliness is a high priority for me and Luna2 is unparalleled in this area.The in house food is delicious and fresh.  The scrambled eggs are the best I've had anywhere in Bali. 

We have been staying in Bali for 10 years and a variety of resorts and villas however this place is a standout and it seems to leave you feeling like it's a combination of a private villa and hotel.
Our children are 8 and 9 and enjoyed their time there so much.  Their mornings were spent around the pool and down at the beach. In the early afternoons before the children went back out to the beach they were beside themselves with excitement as they watched movies with popcorn in hand in a seriously impressive and super comfortable cinema on site.  The level of service was seamlessly high. Ayu, (who the hotel provided to help with our children) was especially sent from God!  Luna2 guaranteed my husband and I a holiday!

Ku De Ta is a 5 minute walk up the beach passed the Oberoi and the evening walk never fails to
disappoint. I walked most days up and down the stretch of beach early morning and was always welcomed back to the hotel with a cold towel and glass of water.
Luna2 are completely up to speed with all the best shopping destinations and restaurants and can get you in anywhere even in peak season!
In all, our time at Luna2 was fun to be in such a unique setting and I would recommend it to both couples and families alike. On first glance it looks too 'cool for school' and that  may put those with children off but from our experience this is absolutely not the case.
title: GLOBAL & UNIQUE

text: While most locations abound in Bali are directed towards a tropical ambience, it is refreshing to discover Luna2. With its very creative approach to the boutique concept, it is a feast for the eyes. Service is great. Rooms well-designed. Clever, modern & cool.

text:
We couldn't have asked for a better stay at Luna2 Studio Hotel.  They really have nailed the design, it's unlike any hotel I've ever seen and it's perfectly located on the beach in Seminyak, close to all of the hot bars, restaurants and hotels.  From the moment we arrived, when we were greeted by 6 staff and handed a glass of champagne and canapés, our time at Luna2 was perfect.

The rooms are next-level cool with every gadget you could possibly want - multiple TVs, iPod Dock and iPod complete with a library of funky tunes, huge bathrooms and comfy beds.

The staff are ultra-friendly and all remembered our names with a huge smile and were always willing to go out of their way to make sure we had a great stay.  We had several recommendations for places to go to for breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinking and they were spot on with every one - it's great to have staff that are in tune with the 'places to be' in Bali.

The private nightclub 'POP!' downstairs is great fun if you're there with a group, with the staff happy to open it up for you and play your music through their huge soundsystem.  You can also chill out in your private movie cinema and watch a movie of your choice!

The poolside area is fantastic as well, we had it to ourself the entire stay.

All in all, it was a perfect stay!  With only 14 rooms at the hotel, the level of service is next level with the number of staff always outnumbering guests.  You can't go wrong by staying there.
title: Out of this World! Luxury Hotel like no other!

text:

text: I have stayed here twice on business and also my family enjoyed a night here. As a business hotel it is terrific, everything works and it's easy to get swiftly through breakfast and jump in a cab. The rooms are great to work in and the wifi works perfectly. The rooms are wacky - no pastel shades on view. My son thinks this is the coolest hotel on the planet, and the cinema is terrific. Meanwhile we took advantage of the many bars in the Hotel and sampled some great continental food. The beach is only 100m away and it's a nice area, busy enough to be interesting, but not over-run and not far from the Seminyak beach bars. text: An amazingly designed boutique hotel this is the place to stay in Seminyak.  The staff were fantastic and made sure we were looked after at all times.  You don't have to leave the hotel with an amazing wine collection, Pop! An exclusive club and the cinema in the complex we had a fabulous time.  The food was also amazing and  Alanna, the Executive Sous Chef was great at catering for exactly what we wanted.  Highly recommend it and I definitely come back for the 5 star treatment
title: Pop! This place stands out!

text:
This is no ordinary hotel. From pick up at the airport in a groovy Luna Smart car (cold towels and cold beer too) to arrival you are in for an experience. Eclectic art greets you in the lobby together with an earthbound friendly welcome from the staff.

My room was large - and the bathroom huge by most hotel standards. There was a glass wall by the bath overlooking the room but the loo and shower had their own doors.

The bed was large and comfortable but the ceiling mirror over the right hand bottom of the bed led to a certain amount of speculation.

Televisions everywhere - huge opposite the bed - smaller above the bath and one with headphones for anyone wanting to watch an alternative movie.

All the other gadgets too - I- pad etc. - i didn't have time to play with them all. A retro fridge with a very well stocked minibar. Fast internet included and plenty of work space. My room - blue themed- overlooked the pool as all but one suite on the top floor do.

The roof top bar with its view over the sea is a must for sundowner cocktails and the sunset view is quite fantastic.

Later on its the basement bar with the viewing room next door that is the attraction. A huge screen for movies and very comfortable recliner seats - children loved the supply of pop corn!

Its an intimate but refined area and the staff aren't slow to notice an empty glass. Even if you go out to supper elsewhere this is a fun place to finish off the evening.

The walk to the beach is a couple of hundred metres down a private gang - past the Luna 2 private hotel to miles of sandy beach and rolling waves. Go for a walk down the beach early in the morning - its empty apart from some early morning joggers and a few people on horseback exercising their horses in the shallow water. Return to a delicious cooked breakfast in the dining room together with faxed copies of the UK papers - bliss if the Jakarta Post is the only alternative.

If you seek the Bali of Eat, Pray, Love this may not be for you - if you want comfort, attention to detail and pampering it is - and it works wonderfully for children too.
title: Unique in Bali

text:
Family trip to Bali with our two girls (6 and 8). 

5 fantastic days at this very specific, one of a kind Design Hotel.  

Did you know that one could say it is kind of a very individual spacey design hip hotel with the special features of a small "family run" high-end caring hospitality oasis.

Did you know that we got picked up by the Luna2 Mobil at Hanging Gaardens in Ubud and that the 2 hrs drive to the Hotel was already an experience filled with professionalism and great hospitality?

Did you know that the interior design concept is quite unique and I could imagine that is would not suit the everyone`s taste. But that would be boring anyhow, right?

Did you know that the staff literally can read your mind? Starting from the security team to the receptionist via the kitchen staff and management team. 

Did you know that if you are looking for Bali furniture the reception team provides you with the intelligence for various nice places to go...

Did you know that the chef(s) actually care about your likes and dislikes and while asking for same in the very beginning they afterwards try to match same. In our case fantastic meals matching exactly the needs of two hungry girls for - inter alia - basic pasta and some fresh veggies while their parents were looking for a more distinguished variable but still basic and healthy food experience. 

Did you know that the pool has underwater music playing?

Did you know that the staff even organizes some coconut milk for you at very inhuman hours if you would suffer some stomach problems?

Did you know that the private movie theater experience really is one of a kind? Forget about Singaporean Golden Village Business Class. I must assume that neither LeBron James nor any other Hollywood VIP does have a nicer private movie Theater at their premises...

Did you know that the location is within 2-3 minutes foot walking to the sea?

Did you know that compared to other high end places this one is not lacking of kindness and heartiness while providing you with high privacy and discretion.

Did you know that I would consider Luna2 NOT to be first choice for a family with toddlers or below? I would say it is rather a place for couples, groups or families with kids at age 8 or above... But still, our two girls felt very comfortable at all time. The staff was very kids friendly and there were all kinds of kids entertainment stuff like games or so available.

Did you know that the view from the roof top bar is amazing?

Did you know that the bar tender puts some cucumber and pepper in your Hendricks Gin and Tonic?

Did you know that we will return next week...?
title: Amazing Luna2 family experience

locations.name: Luna2 Seminyak by Premier Hospitality Asia

text: Having stayed in many great hotels around the world I've never felt compelled to write a review... until now. The setup, style location and staff at Luna2 make this a unique experience and we loved the beach front location, food and details such as the I-pad in the room and the private cinema (with the best reclining seats!). But the thing that makes this place really special are the people that run it, from the security on the door to the reception and kitchen staff, everyone went out of their way to make our stay perfect. From helping us plan our visit to the Gilly Islands to rescheduling a movie for us to watch in the cinema, to helping us search for a pair of lost glasses, the staff made an incredible effort throughout our visit. This may not be a traditional Bali hotel but the service alone is truly world class.
title: Great stay with incredible service

text:
That's what my daughter said while we were at the Luna2 Studios. 

The Luna2 experience is like nothing else I've encountered in decades of visiting Bali. If you want a traditional Balinese welcome/atmosphere, then this is not the place for you. But if you want a cool, funky place to stay in the heart of Bali's top end social scene, then you should not look elsewhere.

From the Lego-meets-Monopoly-meets-retro decor, to the facilities offered and level of service, everything was of the highest order. It was wonderful to have a decent-length pool (complete with underwater music!), the children could have disappeared for life into the cinema and both the basement and roof-top bars were great. 

There were original, creative cocktails that were to die for and while the menu was not super-extensive, the quality of the food was excellent - I'll take quality over quantity any day.

The bed was comfortable, the amenities offered in the room (sunblock etc) were carefully thought out and the fact there were three TVs was appreciated by the whole family.

In short, it's going to be tricky to convince the family to stay anywhere else on the Island of the Gods.
title: "I think I'm going to cry when we leave..."

text: Seminyak itself is full and vibrant with beautiful surf beaches. Luna2 boasts bucketfuls of retro décor and nostalgic tweaks teamed with professional, five star hospitality services, making Luna2 a paradise for any jet-setting design-junky.  The friendly but discreet service at Luna2 studios encourages you to sit back and relax, with the overwhelming feeling that no demand is too big. After following the Monopoly board-inspired hallway to my room, I was thrilled to see bedrooms of an equally quirky caliber with bold colours and patterns creating lively, fun-filled pads with all the comforts and gadgets you could possibly require. The culinary expertise available at Luna2 studios was made apparent from the very first sunset canapé. The head chef, Brenden, introduced himself to our table and consistently blew me away with a delicate yet daring menu. Later we indulged in passion fruit and vanilla martinis in Pop! the underground disco den with all the cool and exclusivity of any London club but with a funky Luna2 spin. The hotel is impeccably well-kept and the playful touches are a constant surprise! I would recommend Luna2 studios to anyone.
title: Balinese retreat like no other.

text:
Luna2 suites hotel is a very unique and funky hotel located in Seminyak. The colourful decor is original and seems inspired by a mix of Lego, Monopoly and Dutch painter Piet Mondrian. The level of detail in the furnishings is impressive throughout the hotel, as is the level of service.

The food is delicious and well presented - I was lucky to try a selection of small dishes including fish and chips wrapper in small newspaper cones and wagyu burgers. The ingredients were evidently of a high quality.

The bedrooms are also cleverly designed with many bright colours and original touches such as an additional retro-style TV. The fridge contents are definitely more comprehensive than most other hotels, as is the selection of toiletries.  

I was pleasantly surprised to find a cinema room with an excellent acoustic system and very comfortable reclinable sofas with extendable footrests. The hotel also boasts a cool little bar/club with a good selection of premium spirits and  enough space for some dancing, if you're in the mood. 

If you are looking for a fun, funky and stylish hotel, unlike any other in Bali, which still maintains a high level of quality and service, I would thoroughly recommend the Luna2 suites hotel. I really look forward to coming back.
title: Funky, unique boutique hotel in Seminyak

text: An absolutely great product, high design and one you have to experience next time in Seminyak. I loved this place, no vanilla here, space, thoughtful execution with style. Luna2 does justice to the trendy Seminyak vibe. Highlights are is the trippy art, attention to detail and quality products and service. Why can't hotel chains be this cool? Love it and will be back.
title: Just like Bond, shaken not stirred

text: El lugar es rarísimo!! Te sentis en los años 50, muy colorido, pero el art deco está bien utilizado. Palabras aparte para el personal que nos recibió como si fuese a llegar la familia, son muy cálidos, amables, dispuestos a ayudar todo el tiempo. De hecho, mi novio es celiaco y queríamos cenar en el hotel así que charlamos un rato con la chef ( una hermosa y cálida mujer) para que nos explicara que nos podía preparar... nos termino haciendo una cena en pasos, la mejor de mi vida por cierto. Entretanto, el mozo hacía Gracias y charlaba con nosotros, un divino. La única contra es que tal vez está un poco alejado del centro turístico para ir a pie y de noche se pone medio raro el ambiente, pero para algunas noches está muy bien

text: Estuvimos en este hotel con mi marido, una noche de nuestra luna de miel y nos encantó. Al llegar nos presentaron a todos los que trabajaban en el hotel, fueron muy simpáticos. La ubicación es buena, queda a 5 minutos caminando de la playa y muy cerca del pueblo en taxi o moto. Lo que más nos gustó fue el desayuno (elegí un huevo pochado con salmón ahumado que estaba buenísimo) y la sala de cine para ver películas (los asientos son reclinables y nos llevaron cabritas).

locations.name: Luna2 Seminyak by Premier Hospitality Asia

text:
Je suis venue une semaine en Octobre 2013 et je viens de passer 2 jours (Février 2015) dans cette hôtel incroyable, à deux pas de la plage et au centre de Seminyak. Le staff est adorable, toujours à notre disposition, le manager est super gentil et nous a offert des cadeaux lors d'un diner fabuleux. Les chambres sont spacieuses, la musique est incroyable et le design est irréaliste. Tout est orienté vers les années 70, jusqu'à la tenue des serveuses. 
Nous avons passé un moment magique, repli de rire et de bonne humeur. C'est agréable après une journée chargée dans Bali de se poser dans cet hôtel et de se sentir chez soi, près d'un bon film ou en dinant a cote de la piscine. Le coucher de soleil vu de la terrasse a tout son charme, surtout avec un cocktail et des petits fours a disposition. 
Je le conseille vraiment, c'est une expérience à faire au moins une fois dans sa vie. Ayant énormément voyagé, je n'ai jamais vu un autre endroit comme cela au monde.

Thank you Luna2 for everything, 

Charlotte
title: Incroyable

text:
On aime ou pas la décoration de cet hôtel ultra design. Nous on a demandé à prendre une chambre d'une autre couleur car la chambre jaune nous a donné des nausées... Du coup on a eu une chambre moins grande sans possibilité de remboursement bien sûr. Passé le côté design, ce qui est vraiment dommageable c'est :
- l'emplacement de l'hôtel. A côté de la plage mais à l'endroit même d'une évacuation d'eaux usées,
- loin des commerces à pieds,
- l'accueil de la manager (le personnel local, lui, est adorable) qui n'a aucun sens des responsabilités, qui nous a planté pour le transport et n'a même pas trouvé bon de s'excuser... Lamentable.
Franchement un mauvais rapport qualité/prix pour ce genre d'établissement !
title: Très moyen...

owner_response.text:
Dear jerome64100

Greetings from Seminyak, Bali and thank you for your recent stay with us. Following your review, we would like to thank you for your time since our guests' perspective is of the utmost importance to us. Your constructive feedback is valuable for our team as well as for readers and visitors from all around the world.

It is with deep disappointment that I read your comments about your studio transfer.  As we only have 14 studios and this is high season in Bali, I am sorry we were not able to accommodate your colour preference in the same room category immediately.  Had we known of your dislike of yellow prior to arrival, we would have done our best to accommodate you in one of our other two grand studios. Our team did accommodate your request as soon as a grand studio in a different colour was available.
 
And while Luna2 is a short stroll down the beach to Seminyak’s best bars and restaurants, the main shopping district of Seminyak is only a short drive away.  We are 2 minutes away from the famous Ku De Ta. Whenever possible, we are happy to arrange transportation either in a Lunamobile or taxi.  It is with regret that there was a misunderstanding regarding your bike rental, but our Front of House Manager did her best to accommodate you, even in so far as to offer you her own motorbike for use.  The local and outsourced supplier unfortunately was late and we are pleased you were able to find alternatives so quickly as informed to me before your departure.
 
In regards to your compensation, I personally waived your additional expenses as well as offering you a complimentary night to truly experience Luna2 again on your return to Seminyak. 
 
Thank you once again for sharing your point of view with our readers.  I am personally sorry we were not able to please you entirely.  My team and I continue to work hard to please every Luna2 guest. 
 
Should you decide to give us a second opportunity to make a first impression, I am confident we would be able to provide you a truly wonderful Luna2 experience. Please feel free to contact me personally at +62 361 730 402 for any queries as I am happy to assist.

Thank you for your attention and we look forward to continue attracting more guests to Luna2 and the Island of Gods.

With Kind Regards 
Jonah Roberman | General Manager | Luna2
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Par où commencer ?

Nous avons passé 2 fabuleuses journées à Luna2 Studiotel, et cela restera un de nos meilleurs moments de notre séjour à Bali, sinon le meilleur. Nous partageons les avis de tous ceux qui l'ont classé "excellent", c'est à dire l'immense majorité, tous, sauf un !

J'ai organisé ce séjour au Luna2 comme une surprise de dernière minute pour notre fête, le 10 août, et ma femme n'en croyait pas ses yeux, moi non plus d'ailleurs ! Notre fils a adoré lui aussi ; l'endroit est génial car il a de quoi combler autant les amoureux (avec ou sans enfants) que les enfants, par son design ludique et original, ses différents équipements et services aussi bien en chambre (nous confirmons : très bonne playlist dans l'iPod installé) que dans les espaces communs (nous avons bénéficié d'une projection privée dans le super cinéma, organisée à notre demande, pour visionner un film en français de notre vidéothèque : un conseil, emmenez un film en HD/blueray, l'écran est vraiment géant, tout comme la sono, sans parler du confort des fauteuils...) et sa situation parfaite à 2 pas de la plage au bout d'une rue très calme (en impasse), et tout près des "hot spots" de Seminyak (dont le Ku De Ta, à moins de 5 min par la plage, où l'on a pu passer une soirée en amoureux et en toute tranquillité grâce à Ayu, formidable baby-sitter, que le Luna2 nous a mis gracieusement à disposition).

Il faut ajouter que le service est ultra-performant, professionnel, amical, sans jamais être pesant.
En effet, un tel staff pour seulement 14 chambres range vraiment cet établissement dans le top niveau du service, en donnant la sensation d'être un privilégié, et aussi d'être quasiment dans une villa privée : nous avions régulièrement la piscine pour nous seul, le roof bar également, pour siroter un très bon cocktail face au soleil couchant et en toute tranquillité, idem pour le dîner que nous avons pris près de la piscine : on se croyait vraiment "chez nous" (ça fait du bien après l'agitation du dehors).

Carolina, la manager, nous a par ailleurs grandement aidé dans notre quête d'une dance party à la hauteur de nos attentes.

En outre, nous avons bénéficié d'un tarif avantageux, sans quoi nous n'aurions pu nous offrir un tel établissement, étant habitués à un standard bien plus modeste. C'est d'ailleurs ce qui en fait un souvenir exceptionnel ! C'est juste un peu dommage que pour le 1er petit déjeuner, la réceptionniste nous ait dit qu'il n'était pas inclus au tarif, contrairement à ce qui nous avait été annoncé préalablement, avant de rectifier cela, après qu'on l'ait consommé. En effet, nous nous sommes un peu restreint en ne choisissant que le continental, déjà fort bon, et j'ai pu constater le 2ème jour que les plats qui le complète, dans la formule "américan breakfast", sont tout simplement somptueux (j'ai testé les "œufs florentine", un vrai régal).

Que dire pour nuancer un peu ces propos dithyrambiques et les rendre plus crédibles ?
Des rideaux plus occultants pourraient satisfaire ceux qui, comme nous, apprécie le noir complet pour dormir. Nous sommes souvent confronté à cela et disposons de masques. De même, la climatisation nous semble un peu bruyante, mais nous préférons dormir sans quoiqu'il en soit... donc rien de bien grave.

Bref, le seul vrai problème à signaler, c'est que notre séjour n'était que de 2 jours... On aurait bien continuer à vivre dans ce luxe une semaine de plus, jusqu'à notre départ !

Pour conclure, notre rêve serait de louer tout l'hotel avec des amis, un jour, pour y fêter un événement, par exemple un gros anniversaire : ce serait tout simplement génial !
title: Extraordinaire et surprenant !

text: Das Konzept ist sicher etwas unerwartet an einem Reiseziel wie Bali - und dadurch vielleicht eine besonders positive Überraschung. 60er Jahre Mondfahrer Flair, moderne Annehmlichkeiten und futuristische Elemente sind äußerst geschmackvoll und stimmig von der Inhaberin in Einklang gebracht. Das Restaurant orbit mit kleiner Auswahl aber dafür besonders passionierter Küche ist wenig bekannt aber sicher eines der besten 5 auf der Insel. Schöner Kontrast zu Strand, Sonne, Tempeln und Yoga - das eigene Kino mit traumhaft bequemen Liegesesseln - und wieder einem perfekt freundlichen und aufmerksamen Service. Wer mit Freunden kommt kann im hauseigenen Privat-Club feiern.
title: Privat, persönlich, besonders und ausgezeichnete Qualität in allen Belangen

text: des l entrée avec du gazon synthétique sur les cotes; on est surpris, est on a Bali? et puis on rentre dans une cafétéria et le bureau d accueil, digne d'un self service de province, dont le personnel aurait été habille d'une façon ridicule, et ce n'est que le début. avant  On passe dans un couloir au sol dessine comme un jeu de monopoly qui peut amuser des enfants, ,mais dont le dessin laisse songeur. La chambre de ,modeste proportion est digne d'un hôtel de province  qui aurait rafistole un vieux décor, avec son design rétro pop, et ses couleurs flashies d'un autre temps, De plus les chambres donnent pour ainsi dire sur la rue et ne sont isolées que par une fine plaque de plexiglas  qui laisse passer tous les bruits de la circulation. On voit bien ce qu'a voulu faire le décorateur, un pastiche des années 70 avec des couleurs criardes et des references  au peintre Roy Lichtenstein, mais vient on a Bali pour cela? Pour s'enfermer dans une salle de projection pour voir des films, nager dans une piscine commune, sans la moindre végétation ni charme, Je ne le pense pas et je ne saurais recommander cet endroit étrange qu'a des nostalgiques  des seventies qui n'aiment ni Bali ni la nature,
title: ridicule

text: Невероятно красивые, интересные и при этом удобные сьюты. Соберетесь сюда - не забудьте камеру - тут точно есть что поснимать. В отеле есть все, что нужно - очень вкусный ресторан, потрясающе чудесный персонал, кинотеатр и даже клуб. Шикарный большой бассейн, до пляжа две минуты ходьбы. Ну очень понравилось.
title: Удивительный поп-арт отель
